column172:
NFL Summer Internship Program participants have the opportunity to contribute to the organization's success while receiving an unmatched, behind-the-scenes learning experience. Though interns work within specific departments, they can explore all aspects of the business of professional football through challenging project assignments, speaker presentations, mentoring relationships, and networking opportunities.
 The summer program covers a minimum of 10 weeks, from June 9 - August 15, 2025. Interns will be required to work five (5) full days (approximately 40 hours) per week. Interns will be paid an hourly rate for their work.
 Application Deadline: Applications must be submitted no later than Friday, December 20 at 11:59 PM EST. No exceptions will be made for those who miss the application deadline.
 Due to the high volume of applicants, only those selected for interviews will be contacted by early January. If you are not selected, you will receive an email notification. Please do not contact the NFL regarding the status of your application.
  EDUCATION: Undergraduate junior graduating Winter 2025 or Spring 2026 with a minimum GPA of at least 3.0. Academic transcripts (official or unofficial) will be requested.
  QUALIFICATIONS:
 
  Proficient in Word, PowerPoint, Excel
  Particular interest in the Sports, Entertainment and/or Media industries is a plus
  Strong organizational skills
  Strong verbal and written communication skills
  Strong work ethic
  Applicants must be legally permitted to work in the United States and international students must have all visas and employment authorizations before the start of the internship
 
 DEPARTMENT DESCRIPTIONS:
  AUDIENCE DEVELOPMENT
 The Audience Development team is uniquely positioned within the NFL Media group to offer a valuable and educational experience for any student interested in how the NFL Media business functions, including deep insight into content development, content production, platform distribution, performance analysis, and the strategy that drives all of our resource investments. Additionally, the role will provide insight into how NFL Media supports the 32 NFL Teams via content and platform insights as well as audience engagement strategies. Interns will learn how we employ analytics-based decision making to determine both how we can optimize NFL programming as well as uncovering new opportunities to reach fans in an ever-expanding media landscape. The role will have the opportunity to work with a variety of departments, including Business Development, International Marketing, NFL Media Product, NFL Media Engineering, Media Intelligence, Integrated Sales, Football Ops, Consumer Insights, and the 32 NFL Clubs.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Audience Analysis:
   
    Intern will assist Audience Insights team in performance analysis of NFL-produced content and NFL digital platforms
    Responsible for applying qualitative metadata to key content across all digital platforms
    Priority focus on identifying content that engages youth and female audiences
    Develop insights and presentations
   
  Cross-platform Content Strategy:
   
    Assist in development of a holistic content distribution strategy across NFL Media platforms
    Work across Product, Programming, Content, and Business Development teams to document platform requirements and 2023 opportunities
    Support development of new content, including new podcasts for the NFL Podcast Network
   
  International Expansion:
   
    Opportunity to help develop an international content strategy that leverages the content and distribution platforms operated by NFL Media
    Work closely with content and business leads across the NFL to define key content types that help achieve business goals in international markets
    Develop localization strategy for existing or planned content that helps drive both football participation and general football education in key markets
    Perform deep-dive analysis of PlayFootball YouTube channel to provide insights into content gaps and future ideas for flag and tackle football educational curriculum
    Refine content/program measurement & KPIs for stakeholders across Media, Business, and Marketing
   
 
 CULTURE & BUSINESS OPERATIONS
 The Culture & Business Operations team is focused on NFL LA office internal communications, team culture initiatives and programs, and key cross-functional projects across the LA office and NFL Media with a focus on workplace engagement at the Inglewood office, directly across from SoFi Stadium. This position works closely with LA leadership team, Human Resources, Culture Committee, and Employee Resource Groups at the NFL LA office.
  Culture & Business Operations Summer Intern Responsibilities:
 
  Support operations around NFL LA Community Impact programs (Sports Content Lab, NFL Good Neighbor, Sports Media Sessions) including staff volunteer sign-ups, program coordination and communications
  Coordinate communications calendar pertaining to LA-specific programs, NFL Media business priorities and DE&I & ERG initiatives
  Organize and manage NFL LA employee communications with content planning, copywriting and light design/layout (LA newsletter, microsite, in-office monitors, staff meetings)
  Assist with NFL Media communications and all-hands around business plan updates and progress heading into the season
  Support Culture Committee and ERG programs and assist with coordination of on-campus culture-based activities throughout the year
  Partner with various League departments in assisting with broader League-wide employee programs as they roll out to staff in the LA office
  Assist in supporting NFL Media business plan priorities, DE&I goals and measures of success
 
 DIRECT TO CONSUMER (DTC)
 The NFL Media Direct-To-Consumer (DTC) Group is a new business segment within NFL Media tasked with building a closer connection between fans and the world's most exciting sports and entertainment experience, The National Football League. NFL Media DTC products combine world-class content with cutting edge technology to drive deeper engagement with fans wherever they are, from the stadium to their home, on any device.
 The DTC Intern will support the team in identifying growth initiatives to acquire, engage, and retain the paid DTC subscriber base across the NFL's and 32 Clubs' portfolio of products.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Assessment of short-term and long-term content strategy for NFL Media properties
  Prepare executive updates on NFL+ business performance for senior level leadership
  Provide analytical support on major initiatives to achieve the strategic goals of the NFL's DTC business
  Collaborate with internal partners across the NFL and 32 Clubs to identify, develop, and garner support for initiatives that grow the value of the DTC business
  Work cross-functionally with the GamePass International team to support the broader NFL DTC ecosystem, including:
  Evaluating/auditing GPI placements on NFL owned and operated platforms (e.g., NFL.com)
  Collaboration with the social/content domestic content teams to incorporate GPI posts in their promotion
 
 GRAPHICS
 
  Design and animate motion graphics for television broadcast and digital.
  Essential duties include developing concepts, generating iterations of a "look", and providing daily support for live shows and digital media.
  Responsible for designing and animating logos, style frames, creating 2D and/or 3D content. This position works directly with the Graphics Department Art Director and/or Creative Director.
 
 Responsibilities:
 
  Projects will include:
  Various shows for off-season, Pre-season Games, Exclusive Games off-season dev, Gameday Dev, Daily support and more.
  Design/Animate Motion Graphics according to the needs or demands of the various NFL Network shows and NFL+.
  Under the direction of the Art Director, generate designs, animations, and motion graphics to be used in NFL Network shows and for NFL+.
  Perform the duties of designing both 2D and 3D images/animations.
 
 MEDIA FINANCE
 This position will assist the Finance department in working with departments across NFL Media. The successful candidate will assist with financial planning efforts, perform research and analysis, as well as interact with NFL Media personnel as needed. They will get to work closely with both Financial and non-Financial professionals across the League to complete quarterly closes, forecasts, various special projects and ad hoc requests.
  Finance Summer Intern Responsibilities:
 
  Financial Planning and Analysis including basic modeling and updates to quarterly forecast
  Quarterly close tasks including preparation of journal entries and variance explanations
  Review of legal agreements
  General Ledger research
  Accounts Payable tasks including invoice reconciliation
  Ad hoc projects as assigned
 
 NEWS
 The NFL Media Group is seeking an intern to learn and assist the Assignment Desk in all phases the newsgathering process for both on-air and digital content.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Ability to multi-task and help with daily assignments
  Strong football knowledge and awareness of NFL events and stories, ability to quickly identify players and coaches.
  Demonstrate strong communication skills both verbally and written
  Able to use social media as a source of sports news
 
 NEXT GEN STATS
 NFL player tracking technology, also known as Next Gen Stats (NGS), is the capture of real time location data, speed and acceleration for every player, every play on every inch of the field. Sensors throughout the stadium track tags placed on players' shoulder pads, charting individual movements within inches. The Next Gen Stats group is dedicated to the capture, analysis, and dissemination of this data for consumption by NFL clubs and media partners.
 The Next Gen Stats group is seeking a data analyst intern to help develop business intelligence (BI) dashboards that help researchers unearth compelling insights from a robust database of advanced on-field statistics. The ideal candidate will have a background in data analysis and visualization while being an avid football fan with extensive knowledge of the players and game.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Develop, enhance, and maintain Next Gen Stats research dashboards using Amazon QuickSight and other analytical tools.
  Collaborate with engineers, data scientists, and research analysts to ideate and implement new stats and visualizations for enhancing the understanding of the game.
  Research and develop original storylines and data points for statistical analysis, supporting the generation of content across NFL Network, NFL.com, NFL social channels as well as NFL Media partners.
  Participate in regular review sessions to present dashboard designs, findings, and innovations to the Next Gen Stats team, with opportunities to showcase work to the broader NFL production and technology groups.
  Assist in data quality control, ensuring accuracy and consistency in the stats provided to stakeholders.
 
 ORIGINAL CONTENT & DEVELOPMENT
 The NFL Media group is seeking a versatile and innovative creative producer/editor to work with the content team.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Be creative and develop new NFL content
  Basic editing and writing based on research
  Analyze performance data
  Assist in long range strategic planning of NFL content
 
 ORIGINAL CONTENT & ENTERTAINMENT
 The Original Content and Entertainment department is the storytelling engine for the NFL. This group also plays a critical role in how NFL Media contributes to the League's entertainment events, including the Super Bowl Halftime Show. This group partners across the broader NFL organization to lead our content development and production efforts for cause initiatives, including Social Responsibility, Social Justice, and other important awareness and appreciation efforts. Additionally, this group is responsible for the award-winning series 'NFL:360.'
  Responsibilities:
 
  The opportunity to learn all aspects of sports television production from our team of producers
  Gain the skills of research and pre-production of stories, pulling and compiling footage, scripting and story producing, editing, and pitching
  Have the chance to observe film production on location
 
 PHOTO
 NFL Media is seeking a summer Intern to join our photo team. The Photo department provides exclusive imagery for all NFL departments and clubs. The NFL internship will focus on capturing photo content, learning NFL workflows and growing as a photographer.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Assist photo team with daily photo editor needs to meet O&O, Club, marketing, and PR needs
  Attend and assist on events as needed, from rookie premiere to preseason games. Communicate with photographers on assignments, provide photo coverage, edit and transmit on site in real time.
  Maintain documentation of current and available templates. Check stylized templates for accuracy and make adjustments as needed.
  Build shot list for photographers for all games and events, communicate with various departments to ensure all photo needs are represented. Assist with distribution of game day images to stakeholders.
  Assist with project management and photo research for cross-departmental projects.
  Support League initiatives with social and O&O photo essay content. Develop weekly content plan for photo essays and NFL Focus Instagram account. Maintain photo landing page with up to date featured content. Communicate with Programming team to promote content.
  Assist with maintaining in-house image archive and distribution of NFL images. Ensure proper archival of incoming images from games, events, and photoshoots.
 
 SOCIAL & INFLUENCER MARKETING
 The NFL is currently seeking a summer intern to join the NFL's Social and Influencer Marketing department, to help service the larger team. The S&I intern will support across the department with focus on the social creative team, player social marketing and the influencer/creator program. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of and passion for the National Football League, its member Clubs and Players, and social media.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Monitor social media trends from an editorial and graphic perspective
  Research and Asset management for Social Editorial and Graphic Teams
  Assist in preparing slides for presentation and meeting decks
  Support in the production of upcoming NFL campaign shoots (i.e. NFL Flag, etc.)
  Help with the preparation of the League's offseason player workshop event
  Support team in ideating offseason content opportunities for players and creators around the League's key priorities
  Work with the larger team to identify new and upcoming content creators
  Support with one-off projects for the larger Social & Influencer Marketing Department
 
 STUDIO OPERATIONS & PRODUCTION MANAGEMENT
 The Operations and PM team support all our live and taped content, across all platforms - logistics, technical, and budgetary needs.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Assist with studio catering, craft service orders, restocking Green Room areas as needed.
  Organize and asset tag production supplies and props into the production service catalog.
  Work directly with Production Coordinators to generate production documents and booklets for all studio shows and remote events.
  Assist with live or pre-tape productions as needed.
  Coordinates and executes administrative support including show planning, research and logistics.
  Various production and administrative responsibilities related to studio and remote shows.
 
 TALENT MANAGEMENT
 The Summer Intern, Talent Management & Events, will provide overall support to the NFL Media Talent Management Department. This includes administrative tasks, scheduling, expense management, and Talent Relations team support.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Assist VP with scheduling of Talent and agent meetings
  Provide backup support for Sr Manager working in the Talent Management Department; coverage areas include H/M/W operations, schedules, Talent and production requests.
  Assist with Talent travel and logistics.
  Assist with monthly scheduling of Hair/MU/Wardrobe teams. Requires coordination with Production team
  Assist Talent with Expense reports
  Assist with the preparation of key NFL Media events and initiatives such as NFL Training Camp, Talent Summit and Broadcast Bootcamp. Including logistics & planning, ensuring all Talent needs are met.
 
 Salary / Pay Range
 This job posting contains a pay range, which represents the range of salaries or hourly rates that the NFL believes, in good faith, at the time of this posting that it might be willing to pay for the posted job in the location(s) specified. The NFL expects to hire for this position near the middle of the range. Only in truly rare and exceptional circumstances, where an external candidate has experience, credentials or expertise that far exceed those required or expected for the position, would the NFL consider paying a salary or rate near the higher end of the range.
 
 
  
   The NFL maintains a Flexible Workplace Policy that provides members of our workforce with opportunities to periodically work from a location of their choice while maintaining a priority on in-person work at an NFL office, which enables us to more effectively collaborate, connect, and build a workplace culture that will drive our continued success.
   The NFL is committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment that reflects our incredibly diverse fan base. We provide an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all employees and applicants without regard to status as protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.
  
   WHO WE ARE:
   NFL Core Values:
  
   Respect: Everyone matters. We celebrate diverse opinions, honor hard work, and value every contribution.
   Integrity: We do what's right, even when it's tough. We hold ourselves accountable and always follow through.
   Team Responsibility: We support each other and our communities. No one is bigger than the game, and every action impacts others.
   Resiliency: We set high standards, overcome adversity, and adapt to challenges, always striving for excellence.
  
  NFL Leadership Attributes:
  
   Build Talent: We develop and nurture potential, empowering individuals to grow and succeed.
   Execute: We take action with precision, delivering results that drive our goals forward.
   Inspire: We motivate others through vision, energy, and a commitment to excellence.
   Live Our Values: We embody our core principles in every decision and action.
   Know the Business: We stay informed, understand our industry, and make decisions that strengthen our position.
   Think Big: We challenge the status quo, envision bold possibilities, and strive for transformative impact
  
  WHO YOU ARE:
   Talent Attributes: What we expect for our employees:
  
   Embody an enthusiastic, proactive can-do attitude
   Embrace grit, free from ego or entitlement
   Excel as a relationship builder, with the ability to influence
   Eager learner, driven by passion rather than just ambition
   Encompasses an incredible work ethic with an agile mindset

column172:
Location: Princeton, NJ (Hybrid) – 3 days in-office/2 days from home
 Are you looking for an opportunity to apply your skills and course learnings in a professional setting while also developing strong business relationships, work on challenging projects, receive mentoring from industry experts, and take part in exciting group activities? Then TRAC Intermodal’s 2025 TRAC Summer Internship Program is the ideal spot for you next summer!
 We are currently accepting applications for rising juniors and seniors for participation in our paid, 11-week summer internship program centrally located at TRAC Intermodal’s corporate headquarters in Princeton, NJ.
  About TRAC
 TRAC is a leading chassis provider in North America helping to facilitate the movement of goods from coast to coast. We have built our brand by staying true to our roots while always being at the forefront of industry change. TRAC Team Members are the key to our success. We embrace and encourage our employees to bring their true and authentic selves in addition to their personal best to work every day.
  Your Role
 The Marketing/Sales Support Intern will support and assist in Marketing efforts surrounding the development on TRAC branding, social media content, website design, and overall marketing functions. In addition, the intern will work to develop commercial/sales opportunities, prospecting, database creation, reporting and analytics.
  What You’ll Do 
 Core day-to-day responsibilities may include but are not limited to any of the following:
 
  Intern will assist Marketing with social media efforts, website design and event preparation. He/She will be responsible for daily Industry News updates, support with giveaway items, and support overall company branding and communication efforts to ensure consistency amongst all TRAC Brands including TRAC Intermodal, TRAC Tire and TRAC Services.
  Support Commercial goal of increased Motor Carrier Pool and Term business through email and phone reach out.
  Collaborate with Account Management Team on automating repetitive processes, dashboard enhancements, team reporting, new user guides, and daily interactions with customers including meeting minutes and action item follow ups.
  Assist Customer Service Team with day-to-day inquiries during volume surges.
 
 Required Qualifications
 
  Enrolled as Rising Junior or Senior in an accredited college or university seeking a degree in Business, Marketing, Communications or related field
  3.0 grade point average or higher
  Strong record of academic performance and extracurricular/community involvement
  Advanced Microsoft Office Suite experience with an emphasis upon PowerPoint and Excel (highly proficient experience in PowerPoint and Excel is required for success in this role)
  Strong communication/interpersonal skills
  Motivated and eager to embrace new challenges
  Work independently as well as part of a team
  Ability to present data to stakeholders in a persuasive manner
  This role is intended for candidates who are eligible to work in the United States without further sponsorship or authorization upon completing their education.
 
 Timeline
 The internship program will run from Monday, June 2nd thru Friday, August 15th, 2025.
 We review applications on a rolling basis, and we encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready.
 All applications should be fully completed by February 14th, 2024, at midnight ET.
  Our Application Process:
 
  
   Submit your application.
  
  
   Receive invitation for a video interview with our Talent Acquisition team.
  
  
   If selected to advance, receive invitation for one or more interviews (either in-person or video) with the department manager and mentor.
  
 
 
 Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
 The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

column172:
STV is seeking an enthusiastic and motivated Finance Intern to join our Finance team. This internship offers an opportunity for undergraduate and graduate-level candidates to work alongside our experienced team, learn, and contribute to meaningful projects. This hybrid position requires at least 3 days a week in the office. Preference will be given to those who can participate in the internship for at least 3 months.
 
 
 
  This internship position offers the opportunity to learn and contribute to various aspects of finance, including financial analysis, budgeting, forecasting, and reporting. You will work closely with our finance team to support daily operations and assist in projects aimed at improving financial processes and decision-making.
 
 
 
  Responsibilities:
 
 
  
   
    Assist in financial analysis by collecting, organizing, and analyzing financial data.
   
  
   
    Prepare financial reports, presentations, and forecasts for management review.
   
  
   
    Support budgeting and forecasting processes by gathering relevant information and inputting data into financial models.
   
  
   
    Research industry trends, competitors, and market conditions to provide insights for strategic decision-making.
   
  
   
    Assist with the preparation of financial statements and regulatory filings.
   
  
   
    Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for process improvement and implement solutions.
   
  
   
    Participate in meetings and discussions related to financial planning, performance, and strategy.
   
  
   
    Perform tasks and projects as assigned by the finance team.
   
 
 
 
  Required:
 
 
  
   
    Currently pursuing a bachelor's or master's degree in finance, accounting, economics, or related field.
   
 
 
 
  Preferred Qualifications:
 
 
  
   
    Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other financial software/tools.
   
  
   
    Prior internship or relevant work experience in finance.
   
  
   
    Experience in the architecture/engineering/construction management industry.
   
 
 
 
  Compensation Range:
  $40,874.00 - $54,498.00
 
 
  Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At STV, we are fully committed to expanding our culture of diversity and inclusion, one that will reflect the clients we serve and the communities we work in, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.
 
 
 
  STV offers the following benefits • Health insurance, including an option with a Health Savings Account • Dental insurance • Vision insurance • Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare, Dependent Care and Transit and Parking where applicable) • Disability insurance • Life Insurance and Accidental Death & Dismemberment • 401(k) Plan • Retirement Counseling • Employee Assistance Program • Paid Time Off (16 days) • Paid Holidays (8 days) • Back-Up Dependent Care (up to 10 days per year) • Parental Leave (up to 80 hours) • Continuing Education Program • Professional Licensure and Society Memberships
 
 
 
  STV is committed to paying all of its employees in a fair, equitable, and transparent manner. The listed pay range is STV’s good-faith salary estimate for this position. Please note that the final salary offered for this position may be outside of this published range based on many factors, including but not limited to geography, education, experience, and/or certifications.

column172:
NFL Summer Internship Program participants have the opportunity to contribute to the organization's success while receiving an unmatched, behind-the-scenes learning experience. Though interns work within specific departments, they can explore all aspects of the business of professional football through challenging project assignments, speaker presentations, mentoring relationships, and networking opportunities.
 The summer program covers a minimum of 10 weeks, from June 9 - August 15, 2025. Interns will be required to work five (5) full days (approximately 40 hours) per week in-office. Interns will be paid an hourly rate for their work.
 Application Deadline: Applications must be submitted no later than Friday, December 20 at 11:59 PM EST. No exceptions will be made for those who miss the application deadline.
 Due to the high volume of applicants, only those selected for interviews will be contacted by early January. If you are not selected, you will receive an email notification. Please do not contact the NFL regarding the status of your application.
  EDUCATION: Currently enrolled JD student (1L or 2L).
  QUALIFICATIONS:
 
  Prior internship/work experience is preferred
  Required experience in Word, PowerPoint, Excel
  Interest in the Sports, Entertainment and/or Media industries is a plus
  Strong organizational skills
  Strong verbal and written communication skills
  Eagerness to learn
  Applicants must be legally permitted to work in the United States and international students must have all visas and employment authorizations before the start of the internship
 
 DEPARTMENTS DESCRIPTIONS:
  LEGAL – CORPORATE & LITIGATION:
 The Corporate & Litigation division of the NFL's Legal Department oversees the NFL's transactional and litigation legal needs, as well as corporate governance and policy matters, across the organization.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Assist attorneys with legal matters across a variety of practice areas, including Events, Sponsorship, Consumer Products, Intellectual Property, Business Affairs , Commercial Policy and Litigation
  Research and analyze matters facing the commercial arm of the NFL and its Member Clubs
  Review and analyze contract terms, and assist with drafting contracts, licensing agreements, amendments and other legal documents
  Assist with review of industry standards and market developments to provide input on NFL transactions and policies
  Support the NFL's IP enforcement division to help identify fraud and counterfeit merchandise
  Perform any other assigned duties, as needed
 
 MANAGEMENT COUNCIL:
 The NFL Management Council is the division of the NFL legal department that negotiates and advises NFL clubs regarding the NFL Collective Bargaining Agreement and represents the NFL and clubs in all disputes between players and clubs. The team enforces the NFL Collective Bargaining Agreement and related rules against clubs, players, and other club personnel.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Assist attorneys in drafting post-hearing briefs which involves analyzing and interpreting hearings, depositions, past decisions, and the CBA.
  Prepare attorney for grievance and policy hearings.
  Legal research involving labor disputes.
  Review and analyze coaches and non-player personnel contracts.
 
 Salary / Pay Range
 This job posting contains a pay range, which represents the range of salaries or hourly rates that the NFL believes, in good faith, at the time of this posting that it might be willing to pay for the posted job in the location(s) specified. The NFL expects to hire for this position near the middle of the range. Only in truly rare and exceptional circumstances, where an external candidate has experience, credentials or expertise that far exceed those required or expected for the position, would the NFL consider paying a salary or rate near the higher end of the range.
 
 
  
   The NFL maintains a Flexible Workplace Policy that provides members of our workforce with opportunities to periodically work from a location of their choice while maintaining a priority on in-person work at an NFL office, which enables us to more effectively collaborate, connect, and build a workplace culture that will drive our continued success.

We provide an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all employees and applicants without regard to status as protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

   Integrity: We do what's right, even when it's tough. We hold ourselves accountable and always follow through.
   Team Responsibility: We support each other and our communities. No one is bigger than the game, and every action impacts others.
   Resiliency: We set high standards, overcome adversity, and adapt to challenges, always striving for excellence.
  
  NFL Leadership Attributes:
  
   Build Talent: We develop and nurture potential, empowering individuals to grow and succeed.
   Execute: We take action with precision, delivering results that drive our goals forward.
   Inspire: We motivate others through vision, energy, and a commitment to excellence.
   Live Our Values: We embody our core principles in every decision and action.

At a Glance
 
 
  You’re a motivated rising senior student with a 3.0 GPA or higher seeking a degree in one of the following areas listed below from an accredited college or university:
   
    Engineering
    Computer Science
    Management Information System
   
  This is a learning-intensive program designed to give you essential business insights and hands-on experience in your field of choice. It’s a full-time, 10-week commitment from May 28, 2025 through August 1, 2025.
  Benefits include professional development sessions, networking opportunities, and mentorship.
 
 
   The Spectrum Internship Experience You have clear aspirations and are seeking a summer internship program that will help you meet them. Find it at Spectrum, named one of the 2023 Top 100 Internship Programs in the United States by WayUp and Yello.
 
 
 
   Our internships are designed to provide:
 
 
  Opportunities to gain new skills and elevate the ones you already have, all in a robust and forward-thinking business setting.
  First-rate, hands-on experience in the telecommunications industry.
  Opportunities to connect you with people who can give you a better understanding of the industry and help you accomplish real goals you can add to your résumé, this includes assigning you a formal mentor and interactions with senior executives.
 
 
   What you can expect in this role
 
 
  As a Spectrum Intern, you’ll be essential to two teams — your respective department and your Intern peer group. Department and team-focused projects account for about 80% of your schedule. You’ll spend the other 20% on professional development sessions and networking activities, including the Kickoff Conference on May 28th, webinars, community service, cross-functional project, and final presentations.
 
 
 
   Internship responsibilities may include
 
 
  Entry-level role that is responsible for planning the Spectrum Enterprise network, including but not limited to, capacity monitoring, creating high level designs, initiating network initiatives, and identifying resource needs.
 
 
   Here’s what it takes to get started
 
 
  Required qualifications
 
 
  Must be enrolled in an accredited College or University graduating with a bachelor’s degree between December 2025 - May 2026
  Must have at least a 3.0 GPA or greater in current program
  Ability to travel locally to Spectrum Intern development events and activities throughout the program
  Authorization to work in the U.S. without restrictions or need for future sponsorship
 
 
 
   Preferred qualifications
 
 
  Understanding in Network Designing softwaresuch as Microsoft Visio, Microsoft Office, Network trouble shooting like ping, traceroute.
  Understanding of Network LAN/WAN, IP routing protocols and different media types.
  Strong attention to detail and ability to handle multiple tasks.
  Analytical skills
  Collaboration skills
  Communication skills – verbal and written
  Drives results through effective project and time management
  Proficiency in Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access
  GGN100 2024-44781 2024   Here, employees don’t just have jobs, they build careers. That’s why we believe in offering a comprehensive pay and benefits package that rewards employees for their contributions to our success, supports all aspects of their well-being, and delivers real value at every stage of life.  A qualified applicant’s criminal history, if any, will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable laws, including local ordinances.  Get to Know Us Charter Communications is known in the United States by our Spectrum brands, including: Spectrum Internet®, TV, Mobile and Voice, Spectrum Networks, Spectrum Enterprise and Spectrum Reach. When you join us, you’re joining a strong community of more than 100,000 individuals working together to serve nearly 32 million customers in 41 states and keep them connected to what matters most. Watch this video to learn more.  Who You Are Matters Here We’re committed to growing a workforce that reflects our communities, and providing equal opportunities for employment and advancement. EOE, including disability/vets. Learn about our inclusive culture.

column172:
About Us:Vagabond Cruise has been offering world-class tours and cruises on Hilton Head Island for over 50 years. We are committed to providing exceptional experiences to our guests, ranging from dolphin tours and sailing adventures to historic Savannah ferry trips. As a marketing intern, you'll join a dynamic team dedicated to showcasing the beauty and excitement of Hilton Head Island and the surrounding waterways.
Position Overview
The Marketing Intern will play a key role in developing and implementing strategies to enhance Vagabond Cruise’s visibility, engage with target audiences, and drive bookings. This position is ideal for a college student or recent graduate with a passion for tourism, digital marketing, and creative communication.
Responsibilities:
Social Media Management:

 Create, schedule, and post content across social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok).
 Monitor engagement, respond to comments, and track campaign performance.

Content Creation:

 Develop compelling blog posts, newsletters, and website content.
 Assist with photography and videography for social media, promotions, and campaigns.

Marketing Campaigns:

 Assist in planning and executing seasonal marketing campaigns.
 Analyze the performance of campaigns and provide suggestions for improvement.

Event Support:

 Support promotional efforts for events, such as special cruises and seasonal tours.
 Help coordinate marketing materials and logistics for local partnerships and festivals.

Analytics and Reporting:

 Track social media and website analytics to measure the effectiveness of marketing efforts.
 Prepare regular reports and provide insights for future strategies.

Guest Engagement:

 Collaborate with the customer service team to collect guest testimonials and reviews.
 Promote surveys and feedback forms to improve customer experience.

Qualifications:

 Currently pursuing or recently graduated with a degree in Marketing, Communications, Hospitality, or a related field.
 Proficiency in social media platforms and tools (Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, Hootsuite, etc.).
 Basic knowledge of graphic design tools (e.g., Canva, Adobe Photoshop) is a plus.
 Strong writing and editing skills with an eye for detail.
 Self-starter with excellent organizational skills and the ability to multitask.
 Passion for tourism, hospitality, and storytelling.

INTERNSHIP COMPENSATION
· Housing on Hilton Head Island will be provided
· $500 stipend will be paid weekly (less housing expenses)
· Gratuity is shared between crew members aboard all vessels
· A priceless educational experience in the field of hospitality and tourism
FINAL NOTE:
At Vagabond Cruise we are looking for only the best candidates to fill our internship positions. Make sure when filling out your application to show us who you are and why you should be selected for Vagabond Cruise. We look forward to meeting you!
2025 Internship Date OptionsSpring: February 21st - May 25th, 2025Summer II: May 30th - September 6th, 2025Fall: August 22nd - November 29th, 2025
Job Type: Internship
Pay: $500.00 per week
Benefits:

 Employee discount

Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Day shift
 Evening shift
 Monday to Friday
 Night shift

Work Location: In person

column172:
Finance Business Partner Intern 
  
  
  
   Wilmington, DE 
  
  
  
   Hours: Monday – Friday, 8:00am – 5:00pm 
  
  
  
   Internship program dates: Monday, June 6 – Friday, August 15 
  
  
  
   We’re seeking a bright, highly motivated student to join CSC as a Finance Business Partner Intern in our Wilmington, DE office. This program gives current college students the opportunity to enhance their financial acumen and work in a challenging, fast-paced environment.
  
  
  
   Our Finance Business Partner Intern will develop and deliver financial KPI reports to a growing enterprise. You will have the opportunity to learn and work with Oracle’s EPM Cloud Planning Software, an integrated tool that can be used to consolidate business unit financials and metrics, ultimately facilitating the delivery of data driven insights and value creation to critical stakeholders.
  
  
  
   Some of the things you’ll learn from us: 
  
  
   
    Understand the lines of CSC businesses and how they interact with each other.
   
  
  
   
    Develop a greater understanding of the Global Capital Markets business in the Americas and economic market forces that impact revenue and expenses.
   
  
  
   
    Become familiar with the many different planning tools that Finance Business Partners utilize daily, including EPM, Salesforce, DOMO, and Excel, among others.
   
  
  
   
    Gain experience in creating financial reports and business unit P&L’s.
   
  
  
   Understand the pillars of our mission and be introduced to CSC’s Customer Promise.
   
  
 
 
 
  
   What technical skills, experience, and qualifications do you need? 
  
  
   
    Currently attending college, university, or a similar training program.
   
  
  
   
    Graduating or ready for full-time employment within 12 months of August 2024.

column8: 2025 Summer Internship | Commercial Finance & Business Intelligence - Cerritos, CA
column172:
What You Need To Know
  
  
    2025 Summer Internship | Commercial Finance & Business Intelligence
    Who we are looking for: December 2025 or May 2026 graduates
    Dates of Summer Internship: May 19th – August 1st, 2024
    Desired Majors: Business, Finance, etc.
    Southern Glazer’s Internship Program
   The Southern Glazer’s Internship Program was established to develop the next generation of Sales, Trade Development, Operations, Technology and Corporate leaders. Each summer, the program offers interns the opportunity to engage in career building activities while simultaneously learning and applying industry-leading practices.
   This hands-on experience gives interns the chance to explore and understand the adult beverage industry. The knowledge gained from industry leaders will allow you to build a network of professionals within the beverage alcohol industry and here at Southern Glazer’s. Being a Southern Glazer’s intern means you’ll be invited to our Leadership Spotlight Series, a Community Service day exclusive to our intern class, as well as access to Professional Development workshops and trainings!
    Raise a glass to your future! Launch your career in the exciting wine & spirits industry. This isn't a watered-down internship – it's an immersion into career paths across Sales, Trade Development, Operations, Technology, and Corporate functions. Our award-winning early career program is brewing up success, with a 60%+ conversion rate of our interns into full-time careers. Psst... our secret ingredient for success? It's not in the bottle – it's you!
    Team Overview - Where Ambition Mixes with Opportunity!
   Open your future to incredible career potential. Work for an industry-leader who invests in their people. Southern Glazer’s Wine & Spirits is North America’s preeminent wine and spirits distributor, as well as a family-owned, privately held company with a 50+ year legacy of success. We were named by Newsweek as a Most Loved Workplace and are included on the Forbes lists for Largest Private Companies and Best Employers for Diversity.
  
 
 
  
    Overview
  
  
   The Commercial Finance & Business Intelligence Intern provides data support for our Regional Commercial Finance and Trade Development teams to assist in evaluating route-to-market strategies, identifying commercial opportunities, and analyzing effectiveness of pricing and promotional investments.
  
 
 
  
    Primary Responsibilities
  
  
   
    Analyze pricing, promotions, incentives, and profitability.
    Cross-compare customer selling opportunities with sales performance and brand challenges/initiatives.
    Analyze internal and externally available data sources (i.e., Nielsen, IRI, Numerator) to identify commercial opportunities for our portfolio.
    Provide accurate, timely, and insightful results to commercial leadership, field sales team, and/or suppliers partners.
    Create ad-hoc queries and reports as requested and provide on-going analytical support for these requests.
    Input corporate and supplier programs into designated business intelligence applications (i.e., NSM, Goal Builder, SODs, Business Objects, etc.).
    Perform other job-related duties or projects as assigned
   
  
 
 
  
    Additional Primary Responsibilities
  
 
 
 
  
    Minimum Qualifications
  
  
   
    Must be a Junior in college and graduating the following year
    Reside in the vicinity of the internship or have ability to obtain housing
    21 years of age or older at the start of the internship
    Demonstrated analytical capacity, curiosity, and ability to build presentation/business cases
    Able to organize priorities and work under deadlines while producing a high-quality result in a team environment
    Strong interpersonal skills and able to communicate both verbally and in writing
    Proficient in SharePoint and all aspects of Microsoft Office Suite with an emphasis on Excel
    Must be detail oriented
   
  
 
 
  
    Physical Demands
  
  
   
    Physical demands include a considerable amount of time sitting and typing/keyboarding, using a computer (e.g., keyboard, mouse, and monitor), or adding machine
    Physical demands with activity or condition may occasionally include walking, bending, reaching, standing, and stooping
    May require occasional lifting/lowering, pushing, carrying, or pulling up to 20lbs
   
  
 
 
  
    EEO Statement
  
  
   Southern Glazer's Wine and Spirits, an Affirmative Action/EEO employer, prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. SGWS complies with all federal, state and local laws concerning consideration of a qualified applicant's arrest and/or criminal conviction records. Southern Glazer's Wine and Spirits provides competitive compensation based on estimated performance level consistent with the past relevant experience, knowledge, skills, abilities and education of employees. Unless otherwise expressly stated, any pay ranges posted here are estimates from outside of Southern Glazer's Wine and Spirits and do not reflect Southern Glazer's pay bands or ranges.
   
    #wayup

column172:
At a Glance
 
 
  You’re a motivated rising senior student with a 3.0 GPA or higher seeking a degree in one of the following areas listed below from an accredited college or university:
   
    Computer Science
    Network Engineering
    Software Engineering
   
  This is a learning-intensive program designed to give you essential business insights and hands-on experience in your field of choice. It’s a full-time, 10-week commitment from May 28, 2025 through August 1, 2025.
  Benefits include professional development sessions, networking opportunities, and mentorship.
 
 
   The Spectrum Internship Experience You have clear aspirations and are seeking a summer internship program that will help you meet them. Find it at Spectrum, named one of the 2023 Top 100 Internship Programs in the United States by WayUp and Yello.
 
 
 
   Our internships are designed to provide:
 
 
  Opportunities to gain new skills and elevate the ones you already have, all in a robust and forward-thinking business setting.
  First-rate, hands-on experience in the telecommunications industry.
  Opportunities to connect you with people who can give you a better understanding of the industry and help you accomplish real goals you can add to your résumé, this includes assigning you a formal mentor and interactions with senior executives.
 
 
   What you can expect in this role
 
 
  As a Spectrum Intern, you’ll be essential to two teams — your respective department and your Intern peer group. Department and team-focused projects account for about 80% of your schedule. You’ll spend the other 20% on professional development sessions and networking activities, including the Kickoff Conference on May 28th, webinars, community service, cross-functional project, and final presentations.
 
 
 
   Internship responsibilities may include
 
 
  Basic network design architecture, network augments, reporting and presentations related to the internal network.
 
 
   Here’s what it takes to get started
 
 
  Required qualifications
 
 
  Must be enrolled in an accredited College or University graduating with a bachelor’s degree between December 2025 - May 2026
  Must have at least a 3.0 GPA or greater in current program
  Ability to travel locally to Spectrum Intern development events and activities throughout the program
  Authorization to work in the U.S. without restrictions or need for future sponsorship
 
 
 
   Preferred qualifications
 
 
  Principals of Network Engineering
  Strong attention to detail and ability to handle multiple tasks.
  Analytical skills
  Collaboration skills
  Communication skills – verbal and written
  Drives results through effective project and time management
  Proficiency in Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access
  GGN100 2024-44779 2024   Here, employees don’t just have jobs, they build careers. That’s why we believe in offering a comprehensive pay and benefits package that rewards employees for their contributions to our success, supports all aspects of their well-being, and delivers real value at every stage of life.  A qualified applicant’s criminal history, if any, will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable laws, including local ordinances.  Get to Know Us Charter Communications is known in the United States by our Spectrum brands, including: Spectrum Internet®, TV, Mobile and Voice, Spectrum Networks, Spectrum Enterprise and Spectrum Reach. When you join us, you’re joining a strong community of more than 100,000 individuals working together to serve nearly 32 million customers in 41 states and keep them connected to what matters most. Watch this video to learn more.  Who You Are Matters Here We’re committed to growing a workforce that reflects our communities, and providing equal opportunities for employment and advancement. EOE, including disability/vets. Learn about our inclusive culture.

CrowdStrike is a global leader in cybersecurity. Our University Program is dedicated to attracting and cultivating the next generation of talent in virtually every field. Our program offers paid positions that allow students and recent graduates to gain real-world experience and develop essential skills while they learn from the best and brightest working professionals. We offer our interns a structured program and supportive environment where they can ignite their passion for the future. Our University Program is designed to provide participants exposure to meaningful work that supports our mission to make the digital world a safer place to live and work. CrowdStrike is where your talent meets cutting-edge tech. Ready to start building a career you can be proud of? Join us!
 
 
 
  Summer 2025 Start & End Date: 12 weeks
 
 
  
   
    May 19, 2025 – August 8, 2025
   
 
 
 
  About the Role:
 
 
  CrowdStrike is seeking a motivated and detail-oriented intern to join our team for the Summer 2025 semester. This position offers a fantastic opportunity to gain hands-on experience in project management, technical coordination, learning facilitation, and data analysis.
 
 
 
  What You’ll Do:
 
 
  New-Hire Onboarding Program
 
 
  
   
    Maintain project tracking sheets and Wiki pages
   
  
   
    Assist with scheduling Outlook calendar invites and coordinating peer-to-peer sessions
   
  
   
    Assist with the implementation of new program ideas and design new logos for all programs under this onboarding umbrella

    Assist with gathering topics and recruiting participants for sessions via Slack
   
  
   
    Assist with scheduling Outlook calendar invites, sending reminders, and tracking for 30-minute lunch & learn sessions
   
  
   
    Facilitate Zoom sessions, including dry-runs, managing participant wait rooms, introducing facilitators, and providing Q&A / polling support
   
  
   
    Record, post, and organize sessions on an internal video platform
   
 
 
 
  Live & Virtual Training Coordination:
 
 
  
   
    Schedule and coordinate in-person and virtual trainings
   
  
   
    Send communications to attendees via email and Slack
   
  
   
    Assist with scheduling Outlook calendar invites and administrative tasks for training sessions
   
 
 
 
  Data Analysis and Metrics:
 
 
  
   
    Analyze survey data from various programs and initiatives
   
  
   
    Present consistent metrics in slides and decks for stakeholder reporting
   
  
   
    Use data insights to suggest program improvements and decision-making
   
 
 
 
   What You'll Need:
 
 
  
   
    Currently enrolled in a degree program, preferably in Business Administration, Project Management, Computer Science, or a related field and graduating between December 2025 - June 2026
   
  
   
    Strong organizational and time management skills
   
  
   
    Strong writing and proofreading skills
   
  
   
    Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
   
  
   
    Proficiency with Outlook, Slack, Zoom and other collaboration tools
   
  
   
    Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously
   
  
   
    Creative problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
   
  
   
    Experience with video editing or graphic design tools is a plus
   
  
   
    Basic data analysis skills and familiarity with spreadsheets
   
 
 
 
  #LI-Remote

    Networking opportunities with fellow interns and CrowdStrikers
   
  
   
    Owning impactful projects that move the company forward

    Fun Slack channels (e.g. food, gaming, sports, pets, etc.)

    Market leader in compensation

OverviewWe are seeking a motivated and creative Social Media Intern to join our dynamic marketing team. This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in digital marketing and social media management. The ideal candidate will have a passion for social media, a keen eye for design, and the ability to engage with our audience effectively. This role is perfect for individuals looking to enhance their skills in graphic design, advertising, and digital marketing.
Duties

 Assist in the development and execution of social media strategies across various platforms.
 Create engaging content including graphics, videos, and written posts using Adobe Creative Suite (including Adobe Illustrator).
 Schedule and manage social media posts using tools like Hootsuite.
 Conduct research on industry trends and audience preferences to inform content creation.
 Monitor social media channels for engagement opportunities and respond to comments or messages.
 Collaborate with the marketing team to align social media campaigns with overall marketing objectives.
 Analyze engagement metrics and provide insights on performance to optimize future campaigns.

 Strong understanding of social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn).
 Familiarity with digital marketing principles and strategies.
 Proficiency in graphic design software such as Adobe Illustrator and video editing tools.
 Experience with Hootsuite or similar social media management tools is a plus.
 Excellent research skills to identify trends and audience interests.
 Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment.
 Strong written communication skills with attention to detail.
 A proactive attitude towards learning new skills in advertising and digital marketing.

This internship provides an excellent opportunity for personal growth while contributing to exciting projects within our organization. If you are eager to learn and make an impact in the world of social media, we encourage you to apply!

column8: 2025 Summer Intern – Strategy & Innovation - Culture Strategist
column172:
Job Description 
 
  
   GM DOES NOT PROVIDE IMMIGRATION-RELATED SPONSORSHIP FOR THIS ROLE. DO NOT APPLY FOR THIS ROLE IF YOU WILL NEED GM IMMIGRATION SPONSORSHIP (e.g., H-1B, TN, STEM OPT, etc.) NOW OR IN THE FUTURE. 
  
  
  
   Work Arrangement :
  
  
   Remote OR Hybrid: This role is based remotely but if you live within a 50-mile radius of [Atlanta, Austin, Detroit, Warren, or Milford], you are expected to report to that location three times a week, at minimum.
  
  
  
   The Team : 
  
  
  
   The Culture team is part of the Strategy & Innovation (S&I) organization at General Motors, strategically aligned with S&I’s mission to catalyze enterprise-wide change . S&I is comprised of Corporate Strategy, Strategic Technology Partnerships, Enterprise Innovation, Culture, and Data & Analytics.
  
  
  
   The Culture team is responsible for setting and executing the company’s culture strategy to accelerate our business strategy. The approach is to leverag e our best attributes , while addressing the necessary change to drive performance. This team collaborate s across the organization – partnering with leaders across all functions and business partners such as Comm unication s, Employee Listening , and Talent Development – to create new initiatives and innovate current systems, tools, and processes for impactful and sustained culture change and transformation .
  
  
  
   What You’ll Do: 
  
  
   
    Research and analysis: evaluate trends and conduct external benchmarking on organizations with highly rated cultures to deliver actionable recommendations for the Culture team.
   
  
  
   
    Project support : assist in designing, implementing and evaluating new programs and strategies that drive cultural change.
   
  
  
   
    Employee engagement: lead events and facilitat e workshops with different employee groups – collecting and analyzing feedback to provide insight.
   
  
  
   
    Cross-functional collaboration: coordinate and build relationships with other stakeholders to help implement our culture strategy.
   
  
  
   
    Communication and storytelling: interact with various people and functions to mine purpose-driven or culture related stories to pitch to internal communications.
   
  
  
  
   How You’ll Make an Impact: 
  
 
 
  
   
    Have a direct role in driving a multi-year, multi-pronged, global culture activation plan from the ground up for a workforce of over 155,000 people
   
  
  
   
    Influence company leadership with data and research to inform action taking with our employees and customers in mind
   
  
  
  
   Required Qualifications: 
  
  
   
    Pursuit of a Master’s degree i n one of the following areas: Business Administration , O rganizational P sychology, H uman R esources, C ommunication or related fields
   
   
    Must be graduating between December 2025 - December 2026
   
  
  
   
    Able to work fulltime, 40 hours per week
   
  
  
  
   What will give you a Competitive Edge (Preferred Qualifications): 
  
  
   
    Facilitating and curating events for groups upwards of 100 participants
   
  
  
   
    Design Thinking or Human-Centered Design project experience
   
  
  
   
    Prior study or work experience in the following areas : employee engagement, leadership development, employee relations, or related fields
   
   
    Passion for the company’s culture and transformation
   
   
    Curious and creative problem solver with a willingness to do things differently
   
   
    
     Can turn ideas into action with impact , designed around employee’s needs
    
   
   
    
     Strong organizational skills and can work on multiple projects at a time
    
   
   
    
     Effective communications skills both in correspondence with colleagues around the world and for content creation; a strong writer who can help synthesize and articulate a range of ideas
    
   
   
    
     Collaborator who works well in a team environment and independently
    
   
  
  
  
   Start dates for this internship role are May & June of 2025. 
  
 
 
 
  
   Compensation: 
  
  
   
    The salary range for this role is $4,800-6,700 , dependent upon class status and degree.
   
  
  
  
   What you’ll get from us ( Benefits ) : 
  
  
   
    Paid US GM Holidays
   
  
  
   
    GM Family First Vehicle Discount Program
   
  
  
   
    Result -based potential for growth within GM
   
  
  
   
    Intern events to network with company leaders and peers
   
  
 
 
 About GM 
 Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.
 
 Why Join Us 
 We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.
 
 Diversity Information 
 General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities. GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
 
  
   
    
     
      
       
        
         
          
           
            
             
              
               
                
                 
                  
                   
                    
                      We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.
                    
                   
                  
                 
                
               
              
             
            
           
          
         
        
       
      
     
    
   
  
 
 
 Equal Employment Opportunity Statements 
 GM is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. GM is committed to providing a work environment free from unlawful discrimination and advancing equal employment opportunities for all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, all practices and decisions relating to terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, discipline, compensation, benefits, and termination of employment are made without regard to an indivi d ual's protected characteristics. For purposes of this policy, “protected characteristics" include an individual's actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender identity or gender expression, sexual orientation, weight, height, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, email us at Careers.Accommodations@GM.com or call us at 800-865-7580. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.

Overview
This is a remote internship based in the United States. You will work closely with our marketing team to help execute the marketing plan for our dating app, with a focus on influencer marketing. We aim to increase app downloads and attract more users through various marketing strategies.
What You Will Do

 Influencer Marketing:
 Coordinate with agencies, assist in creating influencer briefs, and help manage the delivery of influencer videos.
 Conduct weekly reviews of influencer marketing efforts and help identify ways to improve.
 Find suitable influencers for collaboration and assist in overseeing the process.
 Campus Event Planning and Execution:
 Develop and execute innovative event concepts on university campuses.
 Manage logistics, including venue selection, scheduling, and coordination with campus authorities.
 Create engaging experiences to attract student participation and drive app downloads.
 Marketing Plan Execution:
 Assist in implementing the marketing plan in the US, including KOL/KOC collaborations, affiliate marketing, and other strategies.
 Support both online and offline marketing activities and work closely with the China team.
 Competitive Analysis and User Research:
 Assist in conducting a competitive analysis of dating apps and social products in the US.
 Support user research efforts in the US market.

What We Are Looking For

 Education:
 Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree or higher. Fluent in English.
 Field of Study:
 Preferred majors: Business, Marketing, or Communication.
 Experience:
 Experience in advertising or media, especially with influencer marketing on platforms like TikTok, YouTube, Instagram.
 Experience with campus events is a plus.
 Skills:
 Creative, assertive, and strong communication skills.
 Regular user of dating apps, with experience using at least two different platforms.
 Availability:
 Expected graduation in 2026.
 Able to intern at least 4 days a week for a minimum of 4 months.
 Preference for candidates who can commit to a long-term internship, with the potential for continued collaboration after graduation.
 Additional Qualifications:
 Candidates with experience living, studying, or working in the US are preferred.
 Diligent, responsible, and self-motivated.

Compensation
The internship offers a starting pay of $20 per hour or higher, depending on the prevailing wage levels in your location and your interview performance.
Location Preference
Candidates located on the East Coast or West Coast are preferred, such as those in California, New York, Boston, or Washington.
Join us and make a unique impact in the dating industry!
Job Type: Internship
Pay: $20.00 - $40.00 per hour
Expected hours: No less than 25 per week
Benefits:

 Flexible schedule

Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Day shift
 Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

 Please provide me with your internship schedule details.

1. Onboarding date2. The number of hours/how many workdays you can work each week3. The duration of your internship (in months).
We welcome those who can commit to a long-term internship and potentially join us full-time after graduation.
Work Location: Remote

Job Description:Join our dynamic non-profit organization as a Social Media Specialist, where you'll be the voice of our mission to help young adults discover fulfilling careers. We need a passionate storyteller to engage our community and spread the word about career opportunities, educational resources, and the impact we’re making in people’s lives.
Responsibilities:

 Develop and execute creative social media campaigns across platforms (Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn).
 Create engaging content (posts, videos, graphics) to raise awareness about our mission.
 Manage and grow our social media presence, interact with followers, and respond to inquiries.
 Track and analyze social media performance to optimize engagement and outreach.

Key Requirements:

 1+ years of experience in social media management.
 Strong communication and creative writing skills.
 Ability to adapt content to different platforms and audiences.
 Passion for working in a mission-driven environment and supporting career growth.

Perks:

 Remote work options and flexible hours.
 Training and development opportunities in social media strategy and content creation.
 Make an impact by helping young people discover their ideal careers.

Duties

 Assist in the development and execution of social media strategies across various platforms.
 Create engaging content including graphics, videos, and written posts that align with our brand voice.
 Utilize tools such as Hootsuite for scheduling and monitoring social media posts.
 Collaborate with the marketing team to brainstorm and implement innovative campaigns.
 Conduct research on current trends in social media and e-commerce to enhance our strategy.
 Manage relationships with followers by responding to comments and messages in a timely manner.
 Support graphic design efforts using Adobe Creative Suite for promotional materials.
 Edit videos for social media platforms to increase engagement and reach.
 Analyze performance metrics to assess the effectiveness of campaigns and suggest improvements.

column172:
Overview: 
 
  We are seeking a talented and driven intern for our analyst program. This internship will expose you to the entire real estate investment lifecycle, including acquisitions, financing and capital markets, asset management, and dispositions. As a part of this collaborative and high-performing team, you will have the opportunity to work alongside some of the industry's most accomplished real estate professionals in the RMR Residential business group, and develop the skills necessary to have a successful, long-term career in commercial real estate. If you are analytical, detail-oriented, curious, and a fast learner, we look forward to meeting you. Your primary responsibilities are outlined below:
  Responsibilities: 
 
  Acquisitions/Dispositions
 
 
  Create and maintain detailed financial analyses to evaluate prospective investments.
  Perform detailed market research on supply/demand fundamentals, economic trends, comparable sales and lease transactions, etc.
  Assist in the preparation of investment memoranda and presentation materials to investment committee.
  Support deal team to negotiate and close acquisitions and dispositions.
  Participate in front-facing activities vital to the acquisitions and dispositions process, including developing and maintaining broker relationships.
 
 
 
   Debt Capital Markets
 
 
  Work directly with loan origination professionals, mortgage bankers and prospective borrower clients to evaluate potential debt investments in transitional real estate projects.
  Analysis and financial modeling of property rent rolls, operating statements, and proforma projections related to value-add business plans.
  Perform competitive set and general market research to validate underwriting assumptions.
  Assist in the preparation of loan term sheets, internal investment memoranda, and quarterly loan asset summary reports for asset management.
  Assist in the due diligence and loan closing process which includes reviewing real estate documents such as leases, loan documents, budgets, appraisals, and other third-party reports as necessary.
 
 
 
   Asset Management
 
 
  Work collaboratively with Asset Managers to optimize the performance and strategy for owned and third-party managed properties.
  Model and underwrite value-enhancing opportunities within the existing portfolio.
  Develop and update strategic business plans by performing market research and financial modeling in Excel.
  Prepare and analyze data for quarterly earnings, board meetings, and budgeting.
  Assist in the preparation of hold/sell analysis and subsequent disposition recommendation memoranda and presentation materials to investment committee.
  Qualifications: 
 
  Currently a sophomore or junior at an accredited college or university. Finance, accounting, economics, real estate, or related majors preferred. Minimum 3.0 GPA.
  Ability to learn quickly and solve problems within a dynamic environment.
  Exceptional organization, communication, and multi-tasking skills.
  Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office products, especially Excel.
 
 
  #LI-DNICompany Overview: 
 
  The RMR Group (Nasdaq: RMR) is a leading U.S. alternative asset management company, unique for its focus on commercial real estate (CRE) and related businesses. RMR’s vertical integration is strengthened by over 1,100 real estate professionals in more than 30 offices nationwide who manage over $41 billion in assets under management and leverage more than 35 years of institutional experience in buying, selling, financing and operating CRE. RMR benefits from a scalable platform, a deep and experienced management team and a diversity of real estate strategies across its clients. RMR has been recognized by The Boston Globe as a “Top Place to Work”, by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) as an “ENERGY STAR Partner of the Year” and ranked by the Building Owners and Managers Association (BOMA) as having one of the highest number of BOMA 360 designated properties in its portfolio. RMR is headquartered in Newton, MA and was founded in 1986.
 
 
 
   RMR’s mission is to create long term value for our clients by managing their investments and assets “like we own it” – an approach that consistently and repeatedly generates opportunities for all our employees, investors and stakeholders. We are guided by six core values:
 
 
   Integrity at Our Core.
   Perform Passionately and Effectively.
   Inspired Thinking.
   Like We Own It.
   Power of We.
   Mutual Respect.
 
 
 
   Visit our website to learn more about what makes The RMR Group a rewarding place to build a career.
 
 
 
   Follow RMR on LinkedIn, on Instagram @thermrgroup and on Twitter @The_RMR_Group.
 
 
 
   The RMR Group is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. For our EEO Policy Statement, please click here. If you’d like more information on your EEO rights under the law, please click here.
