column172:
What to Expect
 
  Disclaimer: This position is expected to start around May/June 2025 and continue through the entire Summer term (i.e., through August). We ask for a minimum of 12 weeks, full-time, for most internships. Please consider before applying.
  International Students: If your work authorization is through CPT, please consult your school on your ability to work 40 hours per week before applying. Again, please do not apply until you know you can work 40 hours per week. This is required for external applicants. Many students will be limited to part-time during the academic year.
  This internship is located in multiple locations depending on team placement. The locations are as follows:
  Palo Alto, CA
  Austin, TX
  Fremont, CA
  Sparks, NV
  The Internship Recruiting Team is driven by the passion to recognize emerging talent. Our year around program places the best students in positions that they will grow both technically and personally through their experience working closely with their Manager, Mentor, and team. We provide an experience that allows for the intern to experience life at Tesla by given them projects that are critical to their team’s success.
  Tesla Finance combines traditional financial planning and analysis with broader business decision- making and strategy. Finance is embedded in daily operations, supporting both near-term execution and long-term planning. Team members are expected to analyze data, provide recommendations, and lead cross-functional decision-making and implementation of the recommendations with the relevant executives/teams throughout the company. Through the intern program, we are looking to find the next wave of talent to drive these efforts.
  Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) works with our Finance and Accounting leadership team and other subgroups to: Lead Tesla’s P&L, balance sheet and cash flow forecast process, including reviewing with Tesla’s Leadership and Board of Directors and working with finance and non-finance stakeholders to analyze the impact of proposed business decisions Develop and track cross-company efforts to improve gross margin and cash flow Lead long term planning for Tesla, including new products/capabilities, and capital need
  Engineering Finance works with the Supply Chain and Engineering teams to: Manage R&D investments/planning for Engineering (e.g. return on investment analyses for new technology development, resource planning, etc.) and develop associated forecasts Track, report, and proactively manage profit improvement (e.g. design proposals, supply chain initiatives) on existing vehicles Support product development by establishing cost targets and guiding engineering, design and supply chain decisions towards attainment of these targets (i.e. cost vs. performance tradeoffs)
  Manufacturing Finance (Fremont, CA, Sparks, NV and Austin, TX) works with the Manufacturing, Quality, and Supply Chain teams to: Manage all manufacturing investments globally and develop associated forecasts Evaluate major CapEx decisions and expansion plans as well as business cases on automation, manufacturing scope, insource vs. outsource choices, and location Lead manufacturing cost improvement for all products, including feedback on estimated manufacturing costs for future programs, identification of focus areas for cost, and execution of identified initiatives
  Energy Products Finance works with the Energy Storage and Solar teams to: Consolidate inputs on business activities and develop financial projections; maintain projections and track actual financial performance against plan Drive cost optimization in product development for existing and future products with a focus on establishment and attainment of cost targets Lead pricing efforts for Energy Products, including installation and services, and business planning for global retail, service and sales enablement
  Sales, Marketing and Service (SMS) Finance works with the Sales, Service and Marketing teams to: Manage investments into SMS activities, develop associated forecasts, and lead profitability analysis/improvement initiatives as the global and regional level Lead pricing efforts, including options and services, and business planning for global retail, service and sales enablement Develop and evaluate ROI for new markets, new business models, used vehicles, and service
  What You'll Do
 
  
   Interns will be assigned to one of the above subgroups based on prior experience, interests, and educational background.
  
   What You'll Bring
 
  
   Evidence of exceptional ability, especially within an ambiguous environment
   Bachelor's or Master's student working towards a Degree in Finance, Accounting, Engineering, or equivalent
   A robust analytical skill-set Excellent modeling skills (e.g. Microsoft Office Excel; experience with Microsoft PowerQuery/Power BI and/or SQL a plus)
   Ability to work independently, detail-oriented, and execution focused
   Strong verbal, written and presentation skills
   Highly collaborative and team-oriented
  
   Compensation and Benefits
 
  Benefits
 
 
  As a full-time Tesla Intern, you will be eligible for:
  
   Aetna PPO and HSA plans > 2 medical plan options with $0 payroll deduction
   Family-building, fertility, adoption and surrogacy benefits
   Dental (including orthodontic coverage) and vision plans. Both have an option with a $0 payroll contribution
   Company Paid (Health Savings Account) HSA Contribution when enrolled in the High Deductible Medical Plan with HSA
   Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
   LGBTQ+ care concierge services
   401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits
   Company Paid Basic Life, AD&D, and short-term disability insurance
   Employee Assistance Program
   Sick time after 90 days of employment and Paid Holidays
   Back-up childcare and parenting support resources
   Voluntary benefits to include: critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, theft & legal services, and pet insurance
   Commuter benefits
   Employee discounts and perks program
  
 
 
  Expected Compensation
 
 
  $36.06 - $50.48/hour + benefits  Pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.
  Tesla is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.  Tesla is also committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. Please let your recruiter know if you need an accommodation at any point during the interview process.

What to Expect
 
  Consider before submitting an application:
  This position is expected to start around January or February 2025 and continue through the entire Spring term (i.e. through May 2025) or into Summer 2025 if available. We ask for a minimum of 12 weeks, full-time and on-site, for most internships.
  International Students: If your work authorization is through CPT, please consult your school on your ability to work 40 hours per week before applying. You must be able to work 40 hours per week on-site. Many students will be limited to part-time during the academic year.
  Internship Program at Tesla
  The Internship Recruiting Team is driven by the passion to recognize and develop emerging talent. Our year-round program places the best students in positions where they will grow technically, professionally, and personally through their experience working closely with their Manager, Mentor, and team. We are dedicated to providing an experience that allows the intern to experience life at Tesla by including them in projects that are critical to their team’s success.
  About the Team
  We are looking for a social media focused Video Producer to join our Video Content team based in Fremont, CA. This person will be responsible for both creative and logistical aspects of video projects. The Video Content team produces videos across our social, web, event and global channels. Each member is passionately driven and has the necessary attitude to work effectively as part of a highly collaborative team as well as independently when needed, in a fast-paced work environment.
  What You'll Do
 
  
   Develop video concepts that effectively serve business needs and build storyboards to communicate the concept to stakeholders and collaborators
   Brainstorm, coordinate, capture and edit Tesla social media content
   Coordinate interdepartmentally within Tesla to plan video shoots
   Identify and scout locations, arrange location rentals
   Permit roads for car-to-car shoots and work with relevant law enforcement, insurance, and permitting agencies to arrange for intermittent traffic control
   Create shotlists, shoot schedules, and call sheets
   Acquire rental equipment and props, hire and manage talent and/or external vendors when needed
   Operate video cameras on shoots: design and execute effective shots for the content. Experience with drone operation is a plus!
   Maintain clear and consistent communication within the team and among all parties involved
   Be effective with time and budget. Be capable of tackling a one day production, a one-week production and beyond, locally as well as out of state and internationally
  
   What You'll Bring
 
  
   Currently pursuing a degree in Film, Production, or similar
   Experienced camera operator and video producer
   Pre-production and shoot planning experience
   Experience developing compelling video concepts, operating the camera, as well as assisting with the pre-production process from storyboarding to permitting and planning shoot logistics
   Creative, organized with attention to detail, able to carry multiple projects in parallel
   Experience with creating content for social media
   Proficiency with Adobe Premiere is preferred

   Aetna PPO and HSA plans > 2 medical plan options with $0 payroll deduction

column172:
Description: Would you like an Internship with excellent opportunities for growth at an innovative, record-breaking company?If so, Join Our Team at IE! Intermountain Electronics (IE) is a leading provider and manufacturer of custom engineered Process, Electrical Control and Power Distribution turn-key solutions to the Data Center, Industrial, Power/Utility, Oil & Gas, Mining industries in North America. Our products range from large scale one-off custom Power Distribution, Control and Process systems to standard off-the-shelf electronic/electro-mechanical components. We are currently seeking Electrical and Fabrication Interns to be based at our Price, Utah facility.
  Why you will love working at IE
 You will love the challenge, interesting and varied work, and endless opportunities, but most importantly you will love working with a team of fun loving, driven, and generous go getters that take deep personal pride in being part of a family that is building the infrastructure that powers the world.
  Our Culture
 We are growing! Innovation and collaboration are needed and important as we serve our employees and customers. We are constantly striving to improve and better ourselves. As a team, we work hard and commit to our customers. If you have growth mindset and can help keep our commitments to customers, you are probably a great fit for our team!
  We Are Looking For
 Someone who can perform quality work. Someone who will have great job attendance and be to work on time. Because we work in a team environment, the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with those encountered in the course of the work is important.
  You should know...
 
  We have a drug free workplace.
  Pre-employment drug tests will be performed.
  Pre-Employment Background Check will be performed.
 
 Visit this LINK for a video introduction and explanation of the program Paid Internships Meet Classic College Life
  IE has teamed up with USU Eastern to provide paid internships for those interested in the Electrical and Fabrication/Welding fields. Get a jumpstart on your career in an in-demand industry, and still enjoy a classic college experience! Apply Now! PROGRAM DETAILS
 
  The internship is 90 days and participants will earn 6 - 8 Utah State University - Eastern college credits.
  Students reside in the heart of Utah’s Castle Country and enjoy rich student life traditions like Gibby, Lite Brite, and opportunities to cheer on their peers with 8 athletic teams. Students also have full access to all the student resources available on campus.
  High school graduates accepted into the internship program will be paid $14 per hour.
  The majority of internship course work will be conducted on-site at Intermountain Electronics.
  Space is limited each semester.
  Any applicants accepted to USU, but not accepted into the internship, can still be admitted to USU and are welcome to pursue other programs of interest that are available. USU Eastern has a wide variety of technical education degrees and programs.
 
  INTERNSHIP AREAS
 
  Fabrication/Welding
  Electrical
 
  INTERNSHIP AT IE STARTS:
 
  May 2025 - August 2025
 
  WHERE:
 
  IE - Price, Utah
 
  WHO IS ELIGIBLE:
 
  Must be 18+ years of age
  Must be a high school graduate or equivalent by the Internship start date.
  Must be able to provide your own transportation from USUE Dormitories to IE.
 
  WHAT DO YOU GET FOR PARTICPATING:
 
  Paid Internship ($14+ per hour minimum).
  No cost for campus housing (except deposit) and meal plan.
  Earn 6-8 college credits at no cost.
  Access to academic and student life resources.
  Classic student experiences.
  Immediate, on-the-job training.
 
  Daily Schedule
 
  Interns will typically work Monday - Thursday from 6:00 am - 3:30 pm and Friday, 6:00 am - 2:30 pm.
  Part Time Shifts are available for those students taking additional college classes
  Different crews may have different schedules.
  The first two weeks of the program are mandatory for training purposes.
 
  Lunch Breaks
 
  Lunch will be 45 minutes, typically at 12pm, but subject to change based on crews.
  Internship participants are provided a USU Eastern meal plan and are welcome to eat lunch on campus or go elsewhere at their own expense.
 
  Holidays
 Interns will follow the Intermountain Electronics holiday schedule, not the university schedule.
  Program Costs
 There are no costs associated with acceptance into the program. (With the exception of a room deposit for the dormitories) 
 Tuition/Fees
 The internship covers 100% of USU tuition and fees for the internship courses.
  Housing
 Students will live on campus in the Tucker or Burtenshaw Residence Halls. Housing costs are included in the internship program.
  Dining
 The internship covers a meal plan consisting of 160 swipes/meals.
 
  
    Transportation is not covered from the campus to Intermountain Electronics.
  
 
  Learn more about USU Eastern Housing & Dining. Requirements: We are looking for people who are motivated and driven to work with us.Do you have ambition? Are you motivated to wake up every day and give your best effort?Job requirements are part of the job, but another just as important factor is who you are as an individual. Depending on the role you’re applying for some technical skills are, of course, going to be gatekeepers in getting your foot in the door, but if down at the very core you’re interested in getting better, in delivering excellence, and working with a group of people who feel the same way, then we can probably teach you the rest! We don’t shy away from the fact that we have a demanding culture, but the benefits and the opportunities that come from a position in our family are limitless with the right attitude and ambition.
  How To Get Started
  1. Complete USUE Admissions Application
 All students must submit a USUE application. Step-by-step instructions
 
  Students who have previously applied will log in with your USU account.
  New students will need to create an account.
  Apply as a "Non-Degree Seeking Student".
 
 Apply to USUE
  2. Complete an Intermountain Electronics (IE) Application
 Submit an employment application. Step-by-step instructions
 
  Be prepared to submit a current resume.
  After applying, applicants will be contacted regarding an interview with Intermountain Electronics.
 
  3. After Applying
 
  Next steps for IE Internship.
  Apply for housing
   An offer of employment with Intermountain Electronics is conditional upon the successful completion of a background check and drug screen, subject to applicable laws and regulations. Intermountain Electronics, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer

  If you’re looking to grow your network and gain new skills within a global company, an internship with dsm-firmenich could be the program for you. Our summer internships provide students opportunities to work on real business projects and gain invaluable professional experience. As an intern, you’ll have exposure to many different areas of a global flavors, fragrances, and ingredients organization that works with some of the biggest brands in the world, along with opportunities to network with your peers and leadership. From engaging events to mentoring opportunities and valuable resume-building experiences, we’re committed to preparing you for a fulfilling and enduring career, both at dsm-firmenich and beyond. We are currently looking for a Industrial Engineering Intern at our Newark, NJ office.
  The 2025 dsm-firmenich Summer Internship Program will begin June 9th, 2025 and run through August 14, 2025 Our standard working hours are Monday – Friday (40 hours per week)
  You will gain hands-on experience in a dynamic production environment working on impactful projects that leverage your academic background in data analysis, process optimization, and efficiency improvement. In this role, you will develop and maintain operating procedures, conduct yield variability analyses, and perform material balances and heat transfer calculations for various unit operations. If you are passionate about industrial engineering and eager to make a difference, we invite you to apply and grow with us.
  Join our Ingredients, Production team as an intern and gain invaluable professional experience. Enhance your skills and contribute to real projects that have visibility across the business through a Summer internship. Come discover all we have to offer!
  At dsm-firmenich, being a force for good is not optional. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion is a shared responsibility woven into our daily work to not only benefit our People, Customers & Communities but also drive value. Equal access to opportunities is a given, belonging is a shared feeling, authenticity is celebrated.
 
   Your key responsibilities
  
   Exposure to work in the production plant while working on a specific project and utilizing their academic background to do data analysis.
   Development and maintenance of operating procedures
   Yield variability analysis of a specific process or process step
   Material balances/heat transfers/unit operations (distillations, reactors)
   Participate in process optimization studies, efficiency, and improvement projects.
  
 
 
  We bring
  Opportunities for students to develop skills and expand their professional connections within a company where sustainability is not just a slogan, but is at the core of our strategy and purpose. We strive to create inclusive communities within our organization where every employee is equally valued and respected, regardless of their background, beliefs, or identity. Additionally, we provide an environment that encourages curiosity and an open mindset, allowing for personal and professional growth. Together, we can learn from one another to drive progress and create a better future.
  You bring
 
  A Chemistry or Chemical Engineering student, in their Junior or Senior year, and has been exposed to the following subjects: General or Organic Chemistry with lab, Mass Flow/Unit Operations.
  Candidates must be available to work full-time beginning on June 9, 2025 – August 14, 2025
  An interest in working in a chemical lab or plant environment.
  Safety-oriented, flexible, interested to work in a dynamic hands-on production environment.
  Great communication skills and effective in implementing changes.
 
 
  The hourly rate for this position is $23.00 - $26.00 per hour. Compensation will be dependent on factors that include location, education, training, specific skills, and years of experience.
  dsm-firmenich is fully dedicated to inclusion because when people feel engaged and empowered, their creativity and innovation drives unprecedented progress. We aim to build a workplace where opportunity really is equal, so everyone can thrive. We do not discriminate: there’s a place for everyone at dsm-firmenich.  As a committed equal opportunity employer, we ensure our recruitment practices are inclusive and fair. We encourage the recruitment of a diverse workforce, representative of the communities in which we work, by using inclusive language, diverse interview panels, diversified sourcing strategies. Selection is based on qualifications, competency, experience, performance history and fit with the team to advance fair and equitable opportunity.  Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, backgrounds, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.  We are committed to providing reasonable support for disabled applicants in our recruiting process. Should you need assistance, and are comfortable to share this, please let us know.  As innovators in nutrition, health, and beauty, dsm-firmenich reinvents, manufactures, and combines vital nutrients, flavors, and fragrances for the world’s growing population to thrive. With our comprehensive range of solutions, with natural and renewable ingredients and renowned science and technology capabilities, we work to create what is essential for life, desirable for consumers, and more sustainable for the planet. dsm-firmenich is a Swiss-Dutch company, listed on the Euronext Amsterdam, with operations in almost 60 countries and revenues of more than €12 billion. With a diverse, worldwide team of nearly 30,000 employees, we bring progress to life™ every day, everywhere, for billions of people.  Please note this is a direct search led by dsm-firmenich. We only accept applications from candidates, not from agencies nor subject to agency’s fees, percentages or similar.

Apply today and become a part of the Children’s Healthcare of Atlanta family! column8: Human-Assisted AI and eXplainable AI – Intern
column172:
Company Description
  The Bosch Research and Technology Center North America with offices in Sunnyvale, California, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, and Cambridge, Massachusetts is a part of the global Bosch Group (www.bosch.com), a company with over 70 billion euro revenue, 400,000 employees worldwide, a very diverse product portfolio, and a history spanning over 125 years. The Research and Technology Center North America (RTC-NA) is dedicated to providing technologies and system solutions for various Bosch business fields, primarily in the field of artificial intelligence (for example, foundation models, human-assisted AI, natural language processing, robotics, 3D perception, and AI platform), energy technologies, internet technologies, circuit design, semiconductors and wireless, as well as advanced MEMS design.
 As a part of the global research, our AI research in Silicon Valley focuses on Foundation Models, Big Data Visual Analytics, Explainable AI (XAI), Natural Language Processing, 3D Perception & Mixed Reality, Cloud Robotics, Data Science, AI Platform, Time-series Analysis. We develop scalable, intelligent, and trustworthy AIoT solutions to enable inspiring UX for Bosch products and services in application areas such as automated driving, advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS), robotics, smart manufacturing, enterprise AI, health care, smart home and building solutions.
 Originating from the AI research in Silicon Valley, our Foundation Model Powered AI Enablers group plays a pivotal role in shaping the future of industrial AI experiences for Bosch products and services. By fusing cutting-edge machine learning, data analysis, and interactive visualization technologies, we research and develop scalable and transparent AI & big data analytic solutions (e.g., audio, images, sensor logs) for a range of domains, including Industry 4.0 (I4.0), IoT, autonomous driving, and connected vehicles. Our award-winning team (IEEE VIS best paper & best paper runner-ups) actively collaborates with leading academic and industry groups to advance research ideas and disseminate findings in top AI conferences and journals, such as NeurIPS, CVPR, IEEE VIS, ACL, EMNLP, SIGKDD, ICASSP, ICCV, ECCV, ICRA, RSS, IROS, ICML, AAAI, ICLR, and ISWC. Job Description
 
  Conduct research and engineering in human-assisted AI and eXplainable AI (XAI) for Bosch's AIoT (AI+IoT) business domains such as ADAS, connected vehicles, Industry 4.0, IoT, and car multimedia.
  Implement research results to solve real-world challenges, ensuring high-quality system integration within Bosch's existing platforms.
  Document and disseminate research findings through high-caliber publications and/or patent submissions.
   Qualifications
  Required:
 
  Ph.D. students in Computer Science or a related discipline.
  3+ years of research experience, or an equivalent graduate research background, primarily in visual analytics, eXplainable AI (XAI), AI agents, applied machine learning and related fields.
  Publications in premier visualization, machine learning, deep learning, and computer vision journals and conferences.
  2+ years’ experience in full stack web development with both frontend (e.g., React, Vue.js, and D3.js) and backend (e.g., Flask, Django)
  2+ years’ programming experience with one or more scripting or statistical programming languages (e.g., Python, R)
 
  Desired:
 
  Knowledge in machine learning and deep learning, notably in Foundation Model AI tooling, ADAS, spatiotemporal machine learning, deep graph learning, general representation learning, model distillation, and related areas.
  Familiar with major machine learning platforms like PyTorch.
  Experience in human-in-the-loop and human-AI teaming research methods.
  Strong interpersonal, communication, and teamwork capabilities.
   Additional Information
  By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce - EOE/Protected Veteran/Disabled.
 BOSCH is a proud supporter of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics)
 
  FIRST Robotics (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology)
  AWIM (A World In Motion)
 
 The U.S. base salary range for this intern position is $43.00-$66.00 hourly. Within the range, individual pay is determined based on several factors, including, but not limited to, type of degree, work experience and job knowledge, complexity of the role, type of position, job location, etc. Your Hiring Manager can share more details about the specific salary range for this position during the interview process.
 For more information on our culture and benefits, please visit:
 Culture and Benefits | Bosch in the USA

column172:
What to Expect
 
  In the Technician Trainee Intern role, you will be servicing customer vehicles and completing hands on tasks at the service center. In addition to being a team player, excellent oral and written communication is desired as you will be in a customer facing role. As an Intern, you will also learn about electric vehicles and Tesla’s innovative technologies, in accelerating the world’s transition to sustainable energy. If you align with our mission, are motivated, and willing to learn additional technical skills, we invite you to apply to this role.
   What You'll Do
 
  
   Performs entry-level work in the inspection, repair, and service of Tesla electric vehicles
   Operate a variety of hand, power, and shop tools
   Perform equipment inspections, adjustments and certifications
   Perform Pre-Delivery Inspections (PDI) of new cars
   Maintain inventory, records of time, shop supplies and parts
   Help maintain vehicle cleanliness of customer cars
   Support Parts & Front of House operations as needed or on a rotational basis
  
   What You'll Bring
 
  
   Knowledge of methods and techniques used in the maintenance and repair of vehicles
   Valid driver’s license required
   Must be capable of reporting to training location or local service center as needed
   Ability to lift up to 60 pounds
   Be able to work in a team-based environment and have a "safety first" attitude
   Familiar understanding of the English language
   Basic computer skills, including navigating web browsers and using standard applications such as Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook)
  
   Compensation and Benefits
 
  Benefits
 
 
  As a full-time Tesla Intern, you will be eligible for:
  
   Aetna PPO and HSA plans > 2 medical plan options with $0 payroll deduction
   Family-building, fertility, adoption and surrogacy benefits
   Dental (including orthodontic coverage) and vision plans. Both have an option with a $0 payroll contribution
   Company Paid (Health Savings Account) HSA Contribution when enrolled in the High Deductible Medical Plan with HSA
   Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
   LGBTQ+ care concierge services
   401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits
   Company Paid Basic Life, AD&D, and short-term disability insurance
   Employee Assistance Program
   Sick time after 90 days of employment and Paid Holidays
   Back-up childcare and parenting support resources
   Voluntary benefits to include: critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, theft & legal services, and pet insurance
   Commuter benefits
   Employee discounts and perks program
  
   Tesla is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.  Tesla is also committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. Please let your recruiter know if you need an accommodation at any point during the interview process.

column172:
Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.
 
 Period of Work: May-August 2025
 Full-Time: 40 hours a week
 Location: McLean, VA
 In Office Requirement: Hybrid (50% onsite)
 
  The DoDIN Enterprise Foundations Department (N241) is seeking an Artificial Intelligence Intern interested in bringing innovative solutions to unique national challenges. The Enterprise Foundations Department focuses on building an exciting work program which includes: securing our networks & data; modernization of data and communications transport; modernizing DoD’s Command and Control (C2) Communications (C3) systems; Senior Leadership Communications; reimagining the DoD Information Network (DoDIN); and, advancing artificial intelligence (AI) capabilities where it makes sense.
 
 Job Responsibilities:
 
  Develop AI Computer vision models to support test and evaluation of augmented reality technologies
  Test, evaluate, validate, and verify AI model performance in support of specific missions
  Develop best practices and procedures for AI assurance of systems incorporating AI models
 
 
 Basic Qualifications:
 
  Must be a student enrolled full-time in an accredited degree-seeking program in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related degree and continue to be enrolled full-time the semester following the internship.
  Sustained academic excellence
  Strong desire to continuously learn about AI assurance and testing, evaluation, validation, and verification (TEVV) of computer models.
  Understanding of Data Science and/or Computer Science principles, including fundamentals of machine learning and design, implementation, and analyzing data structures.
  Experience using Python, Java, and SQL to perform analysis and visualization.
  Experience using Jupiter, Plotly, Pandas, and machine learning libraries.
  Experience with Linux operating system.ned excellence in academic performance
 
 
 Preferred Qualifications:
 
  Experience having applied data science or artifical intelligence learning to an internship or research/lab position
  Ability to present and clearly explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  Demonstrate an understanding of AI assurance in model testing and evaluation
  Demonstrated interest in serving the public.
 
 
  This requisition requires the candidate to have a minimum of the following clearance(s): None
 
  This requisition requires the hired candidate to have or obtain, within one year from the date of hire, the following clearance(s): None
 
  Work Location Type: Hybrid
 
 MITRE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. MITRE recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of age; ancestry; color; family medical or genetic information; gender identity and expression; marital, military, or veteran status; national and ethnic origin; physical or mental disability; political affiliation; pregnancy; race; religion; sex; sexual orientation; and any other protected characteristics. For further information please visit the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission website EEO is the Law Poster and Pay Transparency.
 
 MITRE intends to maintain a website that is fully accessible to all individuals. If you are unable to search or apply for jobs and would like to request a reasonable accommodation for any part of MITRE’s employment process, please email recruitinghelp@mitre.org.
 
 Copyright © 2024, The MITRE Corporation. All rights reserved. MITRE is a registered trademark of The MITRE Corporation. Material on this site may be copied and distributed with permission only. Benefits information may be found here

column172:
NFL Summer Internship Program participants have the opportunity to contribute to the organization's success while receiving an unmatched, behind-the-scenes learning experience. Though interns work within specific departments, they can explore all aspects of the business of professional football through challenging project assignments, speaker presentations, mentoring relationships, and networking opportunities.
 The summer program covers a minimum of 10 weeks, from June 9 - August 15, 2025. Interns will be required to work five (5) full days (approximately 40 hours) per week. Interns will be paid an hourly rate for their work.
 Application Deadline: Applications must be submitted no later than Friday, December 20 at 11:59 PM EST. No exceptions will be made for those who miss the application deadline.
 Due to the high volume of applicants, only those selected for interviews will be contacted by early January. If you are not selected, you will receive an email notification. Please do not contact the NFL regarding the status of your application.
  EDUCATION: Undergraduate junior graduating Winter 2025 or Spring 2026 with a minimum GPA of at least 3.0. Academic transcripts (official or unofficial) will be requested.
  QUALIFICATIONS:
 
  Proficient in Word, PowerPoint, Excel
  Particular interest in the Sports, Entertainment and/or Media industries is a plus
  Strong organizational skills
  Strong verbal and written communication skills
  Strong work ethic
  Applicants must be legally permitted to work in the United States and international students must have all visas and employment authorizations before the start of the internship
 
 DEPARTMENT DESCRIPTIONS:
  AUDIENCE DEVELOPMENT
 The Audience Development team is uniquely positioned within the NFL Media group to offer a valuable and educational experience for any student interested in how the NFL Media business functions, including deep insight into content development, content production, platform distribution, performance analysis, and the strategy that drives all of our resource investments. Additionally, the role will provide insight into how NFL Media supports the 32 NFL Teams via content and platform insights as well as audience engagement strategies. Interns will learn how we employ analytics-based decision making to determine both how we can optimize NFL programming as well as uncovering new opportunities to reach fans in an ever-expanding media landscape. The role will have the opportunity to work with a variety of departments, including Business Development, International Marketing, NFL Media Product, NFL Media Engineering, Media Intelligence, Integrated Sales, Football Ops, Consumer Insights, and the 32 NFL Clubs.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Audience Analysis:
   
    Intern will assist Audience Insights team in performance analysis of NFL-produced content and NFL digital platforms
    Responsible for applying qualitative metadata to key content across all digital platforms
    Priority focus on identifying content that engages youth and female audiences
    Develop insights and presentations
   
  Cross-platform Content Strategy:
   
    Assist in development of a holistic content distribution strategy across NFL Media platforms
    Work across Product, Programming, Content, and Business Development teams to document platform requirements and 2023 opportunities
    Support development of new content, including new podcasts for the NFL Podcast Network
   
  International Expansion:
   
    Opportunity to help develop an international content strategy that leverages the content and distribution platforms operated by NFL Media
    Work closely with content and business leads across the NFL to define key content types that help achieve business goals in international markets
    Develop localization strategy for existing or planned content that helps drive both football participation and general football education in key markets
    Perform deep-dive analysis of PlayFootball YouTube channel to provide insights into content gaps and future ideas for flag and tackle football educational curriculum
    Refine content/program measurement & KPIs for stakeholders across Media, Business, and Marketing
   
 
 CULTURE & BUSINESS OPERATIONS
 The Culture & Business Operations team is focused on NFL LA office internal communications, team culture initiatives and programs, and key cross-functional projects across the LA office and NFL Media with a focus on workplace engagement at the Inglewood office, directly across from SoFi Stadium. This position works closely with LA leadership team, Human Resources, Culture Committee, and Employee Resource Groups at the NFL LA office.
  Culture & Business Operations Summer Intern Responsibilities:
 
  Support operations around NFL LA Community Impact programs (Sports Content Lab, NFL Good Neighbor, Sports Media Sessions) including staff volunteer sign-ups, program coordination and communications
  Coordinate communications calendar pertaining to LA-specific programs, NFL Media business priorities and DE&I & ERG initiatives
  Organize and manage NFL LA employee communications with content planning, copywriting and light design/layout (LA newsletter, microsite, in-office monitors, staff meetings)
  Assist with NFL Media communications and all-hands around business plan updates and progress heading into the season
  Support Culture Committee and ERG programs and assist with coordination of on-campus culture-based activities throughout the year
  Partner with various League departments in assisting with broader League-wide employee programs as they roll out to staff in the LA office
  Assist in supporting NFL Media business plan priorities, DE&I goals and measures of success
 
 DIRECT TO CONSUMER (DTC)
 The NFL Media Direct-To-Consumer (DTC) Group is a new business segment within NFL Media tasked with building a closer connection between fans and the world's most exciting sports and entertainment experience, The National Football League. NFL Media DTC products combine world-class content with cutting edge technology to drive deeper engagement with fans wherever they are, from the stadium to their home, on any device.
 The DTC Intern will support the team in identifying growth initiatives to acquire, engage, and retain the paid DTC subscriber base across the NFL's and 32 Clubs' portfolio of products.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Assessment of short-term and long-term content strategy for NFL Media properties
  Prepare executive updates on NFL+ business performance for senior level leadership
  Provide analytical support on major initiatives to achieve the strategic goals of the NFL's DTC business
  Collaborate with internal partners across the NFL and 32 Clubs to identify, develop, and garner support for initiatives that grow the value of the DTC business
  Work cross-functionally with the GamePass International team to support the broader NFL DTC ecosystem, including:
  Evaluating/auditing GPI placements on NFL owned and operated platforms (e.g., NFL.com)
  Collaboration with the social/content domestic content teams to incorporate GPI posts in their promotion
 
 GRAPHICS
 
  Design and animate motion graphics for television broadcast and digital.
  Essential duties include developing concepts, generating iterations of a "look", and providing daily support for live shows and digital media.
  Responsible for designing and animating logos, style frames, creating 2D and/or 3D content. This position works directly with the Graphics Department Art Director and/or Creative Director.
 
 Responsibilities:
 
  Projects will include:
  Various shows for off-season, Pre-season Games, Exclusive Games off-season dev, Gameday Dev, Daily support and more.
  Design/Animate Motion Graphics according to the needs or demands of the various NFL Network shows and NFL+.
  Under the direction of the Art Director, generate designs, animations, and motion graphics to be used in NFL Network shows and for NFL+.
  Perform the duties of designing both 2D and 3D images/animations.
 
 MEDIA FINANCE
 This position will assist the Finance department in working with departments across NFL Media. The successful candidate will assist with financial planning efforts, perform research and analysis, as well as interact with NFL Media personnel as needed. They will get to work closely with both Financial and non-Financial professionals across the League to complete quarterly closes, forecasts, various special projects and ad hoc requests.
  Finance Summer Intern Responsibilities:
 
  Financial Planning and Analysis including basic modeling and updates to quarterly forecast
  Quarterly close tasks including preparation of journal entries and variance explanations
  Review of legal agreements
  General Ledger research
  Accounts Payable tasks including invoice reconciliation
  Ad hoc projects as assigned
 
 NEWS
 The NFL Media Group is seeking an intern to learn and assist the Assignment Desk in all phases the newsgathering process for both on-air and digital content.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Ability to multi-task and help with daily assignments
  Strong football knowledge and awareness of NFL events and stories, ability to quickly identify players and coaches.
  Demonstrate strong communication skills both verbally and written
  Able to use social media as a source of sports news
 
 NEXT GEN STATS
 NFL player tracking technology, also known as Next Gen Stats (NGS), is the capture of real time location data, speed and acceleration for every player, every play on every inch of the field. Sensors throughout the stadium track tags placed on players' shoulder pads, charting individual movements within inches. The Next Gen Stats group is dedicated to the capture, analysis, and dissemination of this data for consumption by NFL clubs and media partners.
 The Next Gen Stats group is seeking a data analyst intern to help develop business intelligence (BI) dashboards that help researchers unearth compelling insights from a robust database of advanced on-field statistics. The ideal candidate will have a background in data analysis and visualization while being an avid football fan with extensive knowledge of the players and game.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Develop, enhance, and maintain Next Gen Stats research dashboards using Amazon QuickSight and other analytical tools.
  Collaborate with engineers, data scientists, and research analysts to ideate and implement new stats and visualizations for enhancing the understanding of the game.
  Research and develop original storylines and data points for statistical analysis, supporting the generation of content across NFL Network, NFL.com, NFL social channels as well as NFL Media partners.
  Participate in regular review sessions to present dashboard designs, findings, and innovations to the Next Gen Stats team, with opportunities to showcase work to the broader NFL production and technology groups.
  Assist in data quality control, ensuring accuracy and consistency in the stats provided to stakeholders.
 
 ORIGINAL CONTENT & DEVELOPMENT
 The NFL Media group is seeking a versatile and innovative creative producer/editor to work with the content team.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Be creative and develop new NFL content
  Basic editing and writing based on research
  Analyze performance data
  Assist in long range strategic planning of NFL content
 
 ORIGINAL CONTENT & ENTERTAINMENT
 The Original Content and Entertainment department is the storytelling engine for the NFL. This group also plays a critical role in how NFL Media contributes to the League's entertainment events, including the Super Bowl Halftime Show. This group partners across the broader NFL organization to lead our content development and production efforts for cause initiatives, including Social Responsibility, Social Justice, and other important awareness and appreciation efforts. Additionally, this group is responsible for the award-winning series 'NFL:360.'
  Responsibilities:
 
  The opportunity to learn all aspects of sports television production from our team of producers
  Gain the skills of research and pre-production of stories, pulling and compiling footage, scripting and story producing, editing, and pitching
  Have the chance to observe film production on location
 
 PHOTO
 NFL Media is seeking a summer Intern to join our photo team. The Photo department provides exclusive imagery for all NFL departments and clubs. The NFL internship will focus on capturing photo content, learning NFL workflows and growing as a photographer.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Assist photo team with daily photo editor needs to meet O&O, Club, marketing, and PR needs
  Attend and assist on events as needed, from rookie premiere to preseason games. Communicate with photographers on assignments, provide photo coverage, edit and transmit on site in real time.
  Maintain documentation of current and available templates. Check stylized templates for accuracy and make adjustments as needed.
  Build shot list for photographers for all games and events, communicate with various departments to ensure all photo needs are represented. Assist with distribution of game day images to stakeholders.
  Assist with project management and photo research for cross-departmental projects.
  Support League initiatives with social and O&O photo essay content. Develop weekly content plan for photo essays and NFL Focus Instagram account. Maintain photo landing page with up to date featured content. Communicate with Programming team to promote content.
  Assist with maintaining in-house image archive and distribution of NFL images. Ensure proper archival of incoming images from games, events, and photoshoots.
 
 SOCIAL & INFLUENCER MARKETING
 The NFL is currently seeking a summer intern to join the NFL's Social and Influencer Marketing department, to help service the larger team. The S&I intern will support across the department with focus on the social creative team, player social marketing and the influencer/creator program. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of and passion for the National Football League, its member Clubs and Players, and social media.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Monitor social media trends from an editorial and graphic perspective
  Research and Asset management for Social Editorial and Graphic Teams
  Assist in preparing slides for presentation and meeting decks
  Support in the production of upcoming NFL campaign shoots (i.e. NFL Flag, etc.)
  Help with the preparation of the League's offseason player workshop event
  Support team in ideating offseason content opportunities for players and creators around the League's key priorities
  Work with the larger team to identify new and upcoming content creators
  Support with one-off projects for the larger Social & Influencer Marketing Department
 
 STUDIO OPERATIONS & PRODUCTION MANAGEMENT
 The Operations and PM team support all our live and taped content, across all platforms - logistics, technical, and budgetary needs.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Assist with studio catering, craft service orders, restocking Green Room areas as needed.
  Organize and asset tag production supplies and props into the production service catalog.
  Work directly with Production Coordinators to generate production documents and booklets for all studio shows and remote events.
  Assist with live or pre-tape productions as needed.
  Coordinates and executes administrative support including show planning, research and logistics.
  Various production and administrative responsibilities related to studio and remote shows.
 
 TALENT MANAGEMENT
 The Summer Intern, Talent Management & Events, will provide overall support to the NFL Media Talent Management Department. This includes administrative tasks, scheduling, expense management, and Talent Relations team support.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Assist VP with scheduling of Talent and agent meetings
  Provide backup support for Sr Manager working in the Talent Management Department; coverage areas include H/M/W operations, schedules, Talent and production requests.
  Assist with Talent travel and logistics.
  Assist with monthly scheduling of Hair/MU/Wardrobe teams. Requires coordination with Production team
  Assist Talent with Expense reports
  Assist with the preparation of key NFL Media events and initiatives such as NFL Training Camp, Talent Summit and Broadcast Bootcamp. Including logistics & planning, ensuring all Talent needs are met.
 
 Salary / Pay Range
 This job posting contains a pay range, which represents the range of salaries or hourly rates that the NFL believes, in good faith, at the time of this posting that it might be willing to pay for the posted job in the location(s) specified. The NFL expects to hire for this position near the middle of the range. Only in truly rare and exceptional circumstances, where an external candidate has experience, credentials or expertise that far exceed those required or expected for the position, would the NFL consider paying a salary or rate near the higher end of the range.
 
 
  
   The NFL maintains a Flexible Workplace Policy that provides members of our workforce with opportunities to periodically work from a location of their choice while maintaining a priority on in-person work at an NFL office, which enables us to more effectively collaborate, connect, and build a workplace culture that will drive our continued success.
   The NFL is committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive work environment that reflects our incredibly diverse fan base. We provide an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all employees and applicants without regard to status as protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.
  
   WHO WE ARE:
   NFL Core Values:
  
   Respect: Everyone matters. We celebrate diverse opinions, honor hard work, and value every contribution.
   Integrity: We do what's right, even when it's tough. We hold ourselves accountable and always follow through.
   Team Responsibility: We support each other and our communities. No one is bigger than the game, and every action impacts others.
   Resiliency: We set high standards, overcome adversity, and adapt to challenges, always striving for excellence.
  
  NFL Leadership Attributes:
  
   Build Talent: We develop and nurture potential, empowering individuals to grow and succeed.
   Execute: We take action with precision, delivering results that drive our goals forward.
   Inspire: We motivate others through vision, energy, and a commitment to excellence.
   Live Our Values: We embody our core principles in every decision and action.
   Know the Business: We stay informed, understand our industry, and make decisions that strengthen our position.
   Think Big: We challenge the status quo, envision bold possibilities, and strive for transformative impact
  
  WHO YOU ARE:
   Talent Attributes: What we expect for our employees:
  
   Embody an enthusiastic, proactive can-do attitude
   Embrace grit, free from ego or entitlement
   Excel as a relationship builder, with the ability to influence
   Eager learner, driven by passion rather than just ambition
   Encompasses an incredible work ethic with an agile mindset

column172:
NFL Summer Internship Program participants have the opportunity to contribute to the organization's success while receiving an unmatched, behind-the-scenes learning experience. Though interns work within specific departments, they can explore all aspects of the business of professional football through challenging project assignments, speaker presentations, mentoring relationships, and networking opportunities.
 The summer program covers a minimum of 10 weeks, from June 9 - August 15, 2025. Interns will be required to work five (5) full days (approximately 40 hours) per week. Interns will be paid an hourly rate for their work.
 Application Deadline: Applications must be submitted no later than Friday, December 20 at 11:59 PM EST. No exceptions will be made for those who miss the application deadline.
 Due to the high volume of applicants, only those selected for interviews will be contacted by early January. If you are not selected, you will receive an email notification. Please do not contact the NFL regarding the status of your application.
  EDUCATION: Undergraduate junior graduating Winter 2025 or Spring 2026 with a minimum GPA of at least 3.0. Academic transcripts (official or unofficial) will be requested.
  QUALIFICATIONS:
 
  Proficient in Word, PowerPoint, Excel
  Particular interest in the Sports, Entertainment and/or Media industries is a plus
  Strong organizational skills
  Strong verbal and written communication skills
  Strong work ethic
  Applicants must be legally permitted to work in the United States and international students must have all visas and employment authorizations before the start of the internship
 
 DEPARTMENT DESCRIPTIONS:
  AUDIENCE DEVELOPMENT
 The Audience Development team is uniquely positioned within the NFL Media group to offer a valuable and educational experience for any student interested in how the NFL Media business functions, including deep insight into content development, content production, platform distribution, performance analysis, and the strategy that drives all of our resource investments. Additionally, the role will provide insight into how NFL Media supports the 32 NFL Teams via content and platform insights as well as audience engagement strategies. Interns will learn how we employ analytics-based decision making to determine both how we can optimize NFL programming as well as uncovering new opportunities to reach fans in an ever-expanding media landscape. The role will have the opportunity to work with a variety of departments, including Business Development, International Marketing, NFL Media Product, NFL Media Engineering, Media Intelligence, Integrated Sales, Football Ops, Consumer Insights, and the 32 NFL Clubs.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Audience Analysis:
   
    Intern will assist Audience Insights team in performance analysis of NFL-produced content and NFL digital platforms
    Responsible for applying qualitative metadata to key content across all digital platforms
    Priority focus on identifying content that engages youth and female audiences
    Develop insights and presentations
   
  Cross-platform Content Strategy:
   
    Assist in development of a holistic content distribution strategy across NFL Media platforms
    Work across Product, Programming, Content, and Business Development teams to document platform requirements and 2023 opportunities
    Support development of new content, including new podcasts for the NFL Podcast Network
   
  International Expansion:
   
    Opportunity to help develop an international content strategy that leverages the content and distribution platforms operated by NFL Media
    Work closely with content and business leads across the NFL to define key content types that help achieve business goals in international markets
    Develop localization strategy for existing or planned content that helps drive both football participation and general football education in key markets
    Perform deep-dive analysis of PlayFootball YouTube channel to provide insights into content gaps and future ideas for flag and tackle football educational curriculum
    Refine content/program measurement & KPIs for stakeholders across Media, Business, and Marketing
   
 
 CULTURE & BUSINESS OPERATIONS
 The Culture & Business Operations team is focused on NFL LA office internal communications, team culture initiatives and programs, and key cross-functional projects across the LA office and NFL Media with a focus on workplace engagement at the Inglewood office, directly across from SoFi Stadium. This position works closely with LA leadership team, Human Resources, Culture Committee, and Employee Resource Groups at the NFL LA office.
  Culture & Business Operations Summer Intern Responsibilities:
 
  Support operations around NFL LA Community Impact programs (Sports Content Lab, NFL Good Neighbor, Sports Media Sessions) including staff volunteer sign-ups, program coordination and communications
  Coordinate communications calendar pertaining to LA-specific programs, NFL Media business priorities and DE&I & ERG initiatives
  Organize and manage NFL LA employee communications with content planning, copywriting and light design/layout (LA newsletter, microsite, in-office monitors, staff meetings)
  Assist with NFL Media communications and all-hands around business plan updates and progress heading into the season
  Support Culture Committee and ERG programs and assist with coordination of on-campus culture-based activities throughout the year
  Partner with various League departments in assisting with broader League-wide employee programs as they roll out to staff in the LA office
  Assist in supporting NFL Media business plan priorities, DE&I goals and measures of success
 
 DIRECT TO CONSUMER (DTC)
 The NFL Media Direct-To-Consumer (DTC) Group is a new business segment within NFL Media tasked with building a closer connection between fans and the world's most exciting sports and entertainment experience, The National Football League. NFL Media DTC products combine world-class content with cutting edge technology to drive deeper engagement with fans wherever they are, from the stadium to their home, on any device.
 The DTC Intern will support the team in identifying growth initiatives to acquire, engage, and retain the paid DTC subscriber base across the NFL's and 32 Clubs' portfolio of products.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Assessment of short-term and long-term content strategy for NFL Media properties
  Prepare executive updates on NFL+ business performance for senior level leadership
  Provide analytical support on major initiatives to achieve the strategic goals of the NFL's DTC business
  Collaborate with internal partners across the NFL and 32 Clubs to identify, develop, and garner support for initiatives that grow the value of the DTC business
  Work cross-functionally with the GamePass International team to support the broader NFL DTC ecosystem, including:
  Evaluating/auditing GPI placements on NFL owned and operated platforms (e.g., NFL.com)
  Collaboration with the social/content domestic content teams to incorporate GPI posts in their promotion
 
 GRAPHICS
 
  Design and animate motion graphics for television broadcast and digital.
  Essential duties include developing concepts, generating iterations of a "look", and providing daily support for live shows and digital media.
  Responsible for designing and animating logos, style frames, creating 2D and/or 3D content. This position works directly with the Graphics Department Art Director and/or Creative Director.
 
 Responsibilities:
 
  Projects will include:
  Various shows for off-season, Pre-season Games, Exclusive Games off-season dev, Gameday Dev, Daily support and more.
  Design/Animate Motion Graphics according to the needs or demands of the various NFL Network shows and NFL+.
  Under the direction of the Art Director, generate designs, animations, and motion graphics to be used in NFL Network shows and for NFL+.
  Perform the duties of designing both 2D and 3D images/animations.
 
 MEDIA FINANCE
 This position will assist the Finance department in working with departments across NFL Media. The successful candidate will assist with financial planning efforts, perform research and analysis, as well as interact with NFL Media personnel as needed. They will get to work closely with both Financial and non-Financial professionals across the League to complete quarterly closes, forecasts, various special projects and ad hoc requests.
  Finance Summer Intern Responsibilities:
 
  Financial Planning and Analysis including basic modeling and updates to quarterly forecast
  Quarterly close tasks including preparation of journal entries and variance explanations
  Review of legal agreements
  General Ledger research
  Accounts Payable tasks including invoice reconciliation
  Ad hoc projects as assigned
 
 NEWS
 The NFL Media Group is seeking an intern to learn and assist the Assignment Desk in all phases the newsgathering process for both on-air and digital content.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Ability to multi-task and help with daily assignments
  Strong football knowledge and awareness of NFL events and stories, ability to quickly identify players and coaches.
  Demonstrate strong communication skills both verbally and written
  Able to use social media as a source of sports news
 
 NEXT GEN STATS
 NFL player tracking technology, also known as Next Gen Stats (NGS), is the capture of real time location data, speed and acceleration for every player, every play on every inch of the field. Sensors throughout the stadium track tags placed on players' shoulder pads, charting individual movements within inches. The Next Gen Stats group is dedicated to the capture, analysis, and dissemination of this data for consumption by NFL clubs and media partners.
 The Next Gen Stats group is seeking a data analyst intern to help develop business intelligence (BI) dashboards that help researchers unearth compelling insights from a robust database of advanced on-field statistics. The ideal candidate will have a background in data analysis and visualization while being an avid football fan with extensive knowledge of the players and game.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Develop, enhance, and maintain Next Gen Stats research dashboards using Amazon QuickSight and other analytical tools.
  Collaborate with engineers, data scientists, and research analysts to ideate and implement new stats and visualizations for enhancing the understanding of the game.
  Research and develop original storylines and data points for statistical analysis, supporting the generation of content across NFL Network, NFL.com, NFL social channels as well as NFL Media partners.
  Participate in regular review sessions to present dashboard designs, findings, and innovations to the Next Gen Stats team, with opportunities to showcase work to the broader NFL production and technology groups.
  Assist in data quality control, ensuring accuracy and consistency in the stats provided to stakeholders.
 
 ORIGINAL CONTENT & DEVELOPMENT
 The NFL Media group is seeking a versatile and innovative creative producer/editor to work with the content team.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Be creative and develop new NFL content
  Basic editing and writing based on research
  Analyze performance data
  Assist in long range strategic planning of NFL content
 
 ORIGINAL CONTENT & ENTERTAINMENT
 The Original Content and Entertainment department is the storytelling engine for the NFL. This group also plays a critical role in how NFL Media contributes to the League's entertainment events, including the Super Bowl Halftime Show. This group partners across the broader NFL organization to lead our content development and production efforts for cause initiatives, including Social Responsibility, Social Justice, and other important awareness and appreciation efforts.
